text: Just tried Grandma's Pizza, amazing! Not sure if I want any other kind of pie.
As a Yonkers, NY native, I am happy to have found Bambinos.  Everything is amazing.
It was good, wings were a little salty if they weren't so salty I would've gave it another star. Pizza was bomb I will probably go back got the pizza again

I'm Italian & was raised in NY. All I have wanted for the last 18 years is a slice of NY pizza. 
A few place come almost close but not like Bambinos. This is NY Pizza. It is PERFECT. Thin, sauce is yummy & not stingy with cheese. 

Just waking in the door is a happy experience. The smell, the NY accent & then the longest 2 minutes of your life waiting for your slice to come out of the oven. OMG I died a thousand deaths waiting for that first slice. It was perfect. Exactly what I had been missing for all these years. Felt like I was back home. Later that evening had to order a pie for the family. This is now a weekly event. 

Oh and the other food is great too but I only want pizza. The hot sandwiches are stuffed full, the grandma pie is outrageously good as are the garlic knots.

The guys are great, personable & funny. The shop is spotlessly clean. Did I mention how yummy the smell is? And how the pizza somehow can transport you to your happy place..

Just go there now & get a slice. I guarantee you will be buying a pie & more before the end of the day.

I love this place...  Having moved here from New York I have found it next to impossible to find good pizza in this city.  Well look no further, if you want good pizza this is the place for you hands down!
My son's and I ordered Pizza, Spaghetti & a Chicken Ceasars Salad. Everything was absolutely delicious! Serving sizes are very generous. Highly recommended.
The slice soda special here is great! The staff is friendly a helpful. This place is real deal Italian according to the older Italian lady here at the same time.

I love this little hole in the wall place.  I called a few years ago, not long after new owners took over. I asked if they can make a bunch of pizzas for my son's birthday party.  He went in early to make the pizza's so they were ready right when they opened. And it was SO GOOD! This is our favorite go-to pizza now. 

I've also had the chicken parm dinner and that was also tasty. 

They are always so nice and hard working. :)

This was my first time eating here. I ordered the 2 slices of pizza and a soda for $5. The service was amazing. I was acknowledged immediately and given a cup for my drink while waiting on my pizza.

I got my 2 slices of pepperoni pizza pretty quickly. It was fresh, hot, and tasted fantastic. The staff immediately asked how my pizza was after my first few bites. 

I didn't have any issues with my food, but if I did, I feel very confidently that they would have taken care of my problem right away. They do an excellent job and they make it look very easy.

I will definitely be returning there for lunch in the future.

Just stopped in by chance on the way to a friends house,  first time in 19 years that I've had east coast style pizza.   Awesome surprise,  great service, good price,  2 slices and a drink $5, well worth it. Brought back memories of growing up back east.  Most pizza here is like cardboard with Ragu, keep up the good work, I'll definitely be going back.

Although I do not care for the red sox, I enjoyed the atmosphere. The owners have that boston attitude but do it carefully not to sound threatening, while having fun and needling. We were going back and forth and having a good time, my kids enjoyed it.

We got 4 slices of plain, $2/slice isn't terrible pretty standard. I loved it. Thin crust with a nice crisp and you can fold it in half and just chow on down! My kids split a chicken bomb sub, was delicious! Like a chicken cheese steak almost! The service was ok, the other people that work there besides the owner just don't seem to be into it as much. Understandable. Love the place though and wish them all the luck! Keep it up!

THE BEST New York style pizza in town. PERIOD. The rice balls are great, the conolis are to die for. Don't waste your time and money going elsewhere if you're looking for New York style pizza. They make delicious calzones, and their other pasta dishes are out of this world. The people who own this joint are old school. You're going to love this place. Casual Pizzeria style atmosphere.
Great pizza.  The quality is great and you cannot beat the lunch specials.    The pizza comes in several choices deep dish, thin, and grandmas.   Pasta is great as well
Best pizza in town as well as other dishes as well. Staff is friendly and service is great.

Cant say anything bad about this place . It has a cozy atmosphere, friendly people and good food . You cant go wrong here.  The service is great they check on you and make sure you get your food soon as its done . Ill definitely be coming back

The Best Pizza place in Las Vegas! On top of that, this family owned business from NY treats you like family. Everything they make is top notch and fresh. Best pizza I ever had anywhere and I am from the East Coast. So stop in and see Tony, John and the rest of the family, you will be glad you did.

Great service! !
Best pizza I have had in a long time. Nice thin crust.
I'm from back east and this made me feel like I was at home!

EXTREMELY DISAPPOINTED in the service!! Waited over 2 hours for a delivery when we are only 5 minutes away. Called a few times for an update on the order and no apology given for the delay the response given "we are working on it".  Food was disappointing, cold and soggy fries with a flat tasting soda.

Im going to give them 5 stars again. The food is spot on. Had a wood fire pizza and traditional and chicken fingers for the family. They are just so slooooooow. I think they need to hire a professional to run the front while the rest just concentrate on making the food and getting it out. Until then, i will only be back at off hours
This place doesn't even use wood fire to cook their pizzas anymore. If you're going to change your ingredients you should change your name

Best East Coast Pizza In Town.  Nice family from Long Island as well. Perfect crust, great sauce, healthy toppings, and baked to perfection.  You will not be disappointed whatsoever.

Great Joint!

Stopped in here in my way home from a friends. Heard about them from right here on yelp. I'm from The NYC/NJ metro area and to say we are pizza snobs is an understatement. When I walked in I felt like I was back home. While the place is small to eat inside, the food portion is not. I had a chicken stromboli. It was large enough for one and was very good. Everything here they make to order! Fresh! And all with a wood burning stove to cook with! That makes a huge difference in taste! 
The staff was friendly and I truly have found my favorite pizza place. Their prices are great too!

Decent but overpriced for the money. The basic cheese pizza seemed flavorless to me. The cheese wasn't memorable and the sauce was non-existent. For comparison, a  similar and similarly priced pie at Rocco's in Summerlin was much better. The Margherita pie was better and the service was good so that accounts for the 3 stars. I will probably give them another shot since they are close.

First let me say that they are pricey but absolutely worth it. Some of the best pizza in town. We always get pepperoni with bacon and it is always amazing and hot. The Caesar salad is eh, wouldn't buy it again but the pizza is the  star here.

Solid Italian restaurant with no frills amazing food.  I had the baked clams with herbed bread crumbs, sautéed spinach, chicken francese, fettuccine alfredo, and cannoli.  The baked clams were tender, not over cooked, with their clam juice, and the herbed bread crumbs complimented the clams nicely, just a squeeze of lemon made it on point.  The sautéed spinach was chopped and cooked soft with burnt garlic, if you are a garlic fan you would enjoy this dish.  The Chicken francese dish had tender chicken with a bright acidic white wine sauce and spaghetti, I have an affinity for acidity and this dish more than satisfied my pH-of-less-than-7 palette.  Solid, solid fettuccine alfredo and they have a strong, like Mr. Olympia-strong, cannoli game.  I will end my review with a quote from Scorpion from Mortal Kombat..."GET OVER HERE!"

The vegetarian pizza was one of the worst pizzas I have ever had. Only a thin crust from Dominos was worse. The positive reviews here are fake. 

I lived in Connecticut for 28 years and know exactly what a thin crust pizza is supposed to look and taste like...Bambino's is not even close. 

The pie was grossly overloaded with ingredients and was soggy. Getting the pizza took over half an hour and there were no other customers in the place. 

There was nothing good about the pizza.
I had a Caesar Salad and a Pizza Margherita. Both were delicious. The pizza Is a thin crust cooked in their wood-fired oven. Fantastic!
I have been coming to Bambino's East Coast Pizzeria for a while and I have to say, the staff and food are excellent. Keep up the great work guys
Friendly staff, and nice speedy service. Pizza is amazing! Going to try the meatball sub w a dessert in the near future.

Best Italian pizza/pasta joint on the west coast- hands down! Amazing spaghetti and meatballs, mozzarella sticks etc. Being from NJ and living Orange County CA and now Las Vegas the struggle has been real finding an authentic Italian owned pizzeria - here it is folks! Family owned! Tomato sauce that is NOT watered down but chunky and authentic. The portions are huge here so come hungry! The price is excellent and overall the family who owns this actually works here and are so helpful and warm! John waited on us today and he was kind and even offered insight on areas of Las Vegas to us! Best pizza and spaghetti and meatballs in Vegas !!!
Best NY pizza in Vegas. I was born and raised on Long Island, and this is the closest thing to home I've found out here. A must try!!

Being a NYC transplant, and of Italian descent, I find most pizza/italian food in Vegas sub-par at best. Not Bambino's, their food is excellent. In addition, they several different pizzas that are impossible to find in Vegas - White Pizza (Amazing!!!!!), Grandma's Pizza (If you've never had it, TRY it), Deep Dish (WOW), and their Sicilian (square) is better than New York shops. I can't say enough about John, he's a friendly guy who makes each customer feel comfortable and welcome. For top-notch Pizza or Italian food, Try this place, you won't be disappointed.

Discovered Bambinos a couple of months ago from my sister. She got me a stromboli that had chicken, eggplant, roasted red peppers, and mozzarella. It was incredibly delicious!  Then another time she had me try baked ziti siciliano....really ggod. I wanted to eat more but I decided that I wanted to save it so I could enjoy it again. Tonight I had a stromboli again, and my boyfriend had a Sicilian meat lover's pizza. The pizza was so crispy. It's a family run business and they are very friendly. Also, I highly recommend trying their cannolis.
Delicious! Amazing flavor, very nice staff/owner. Love the family business feel. If you want fresh taste, anazing sauce ditch the other Pizza Options and come here!

Amazing pizza! Honestly, how is it that we've never been to Bambino's pizza?! We were craving pizza on a Monday night and decided to check out Bambino's after a friend recommended going there and verifying good reviews on Yelp.  We arrived an hour before closing but the owner and staff were so welcoming, and we knew it would be good since it was still fairly busy.  As per Yelp reviews, we decided to try the white pizza (usually my favorite), 'grandma's pizza, garlic knots and the cannoli.  The garlic knots came first: piping hot, crunchy on the outside and chewy soft inside. Make sure to dip it in the extra garlic butter sauce in the bottom of the plate and the sauce that comes with it. Then comes the white pizza: amazing flavor, simple white pizza yet complex and delicious in flavor! White pizza is usually my favorite order, but from the other Yelp reviews, we also decided to order 'grandma's pizza. WOW. Everyone is right. You HAVE to try it. Simple yet savory, slightly sweet sauce, perfect blend of cheese. Then comes the cannoli. I'll be honest, my hubby loves cannoli but it's usually not my favorite. This was the BEST cannoli I've had (and I've even eaten them while in New York!). Not only was the food delicious, the staff and people were fantastic! Such wonderful characters (most of the 'regulars' we met were from Staton Island, Long Island, etc). We were saying this place needs to be on Food Network-it was that good! We will certainly be returning again soon (someone recommended the lasagna pie) and will be recommending this new favorite to our family and friends!

I'm just curious if I owned a pizza establishment and didn't offer chicken fingers or even wings with a pizza combination special some places offer fingers and Pizza and other places offer wings and pizza specials but the thing that gets me the most as in this industry of pizza fingers and wings which is the basic reason why most people call a pizza company for delivery on a weekend or special occasion or just want to eat something is for these 3 main items so if they can't find a distributor that can offer a fair price to them so they in turn can offer a good price to consumer which is us the specials what does it say about the establishment are they overcharging us in order to make an extra buck does the money mean more to them than their name a lot of questions come to mind I've always tried to do what's best for the people who spend the money but in Las Vegas is so hard to find a business expecially and pizza a company with good customer service great product an amazing specials it's almost like you get two of the three why can't we find a pizza company that offers 3 of 3 that being said I've called around I've even ordered and give him the benefit of the doubt and I have not been impressed yet not saying I have expectations what just looking for a reasonable price I understand the companies make a profit but when they do charge more than $50 to get a pizza and fingers or wings depending on what special the offer to me is ridiculous so I always let the company know I found them on Yelp I always let the person on the phone now please take care of me and I don't mind taking care of you but for some reason its extremely hard to find somebody who even cares that matter and maybe the management or owners talk to their employees before they hire are more screen them we are here for the customer and we want to give them the best experience possible instead of only offer this weight off of that call somebody else so is it better to make more money now then way more money later thank you Yelpers

I went there a few weeks and got a few slices and it was good!!!  Then went tonight ordered a Hawaiian sub can. Bacon for pepperoni.  Was overcharged and the pizza wasn't that tasty.  And for the price it was small.  Kinda disappointed because I like to support local businesses but don't like being overcharged for food that isn't all that.  May go back one day... .
Best pizza in vegas im sure that term is used often but coming from the east cost this is exactly what you will get if you do go. Great service great food love there Grandma Pizza

Amazing food and wonderful customer service! All the workers are extremely friendly. They Come to your table and make sure you are satisfied and check up on how your doing.They always keep their dining area clean and they have AMAZING food! Definitely recommend eating here if your thinking about it!

Finally! I found a pizzeria in LV that is as close to NY style pizza as you can get. 

As a NY native and pizza lover, I've been searching for a pizzeria like the ones in NY. 

My search is now over. Bambino's Pizzeria makes delicious pizzas and authentic Italian entrees, just like the food I grew accustomed to eating while in New York. 

Ralf, John, and the rest of the Bambino staff are friendly, welcoming, and hospitable people and have made me a loyal, happy, and satisfied regular customer.

One of the best neighborhood pizza places around. The slices are cut to proper size (not micro cuts like you get at the corporate places) the ingredients are fresh and they don't cut corners when it comes to portion or quality. 

Great people, excellent service and outstanding food. Can't ask for much more than that!
Just had their special 2 slices of cheese and a soda! Very big slices nice and thin and crispy! Very good!

Fantastic pizza. They are generous with their toppings, and while I've never dined in, I always appreciate how they offer to carry my pizza to the car for me when I have my kids with me.

The garlic knots are top notch - not overly garlicky so that vampires run for the hills.  

It's not national chain cheap, but it's comparable to any mom-and-pop pizza joint. Quality food and quality people. I'd over pay for that any day.

We've eaten there several times and have NEVER been disappointed!  The staff is friendly and helpful.
That's why we keep going back
The variety of pizzas are delicious.

Awesome, Affordable, Authentic.    This family run business from Long Island is one of my favorites for Pizza and Wings and they have some pastas that are great as well.  The service is always exceptional and prompt.   Prices are very competitive.   If you're looking for a new favorite pizza stop I would highly suggest trying this  place out.

No frills. Nothing fancy. Just absolutely delicious Italian food and very reasonable prices. Definitely not low carb: garlic bread knots with dipping sauce, veal sandwiches, meatballs on the side. Outstanding!

Hands down the best pizza in Vegas! This former New Yorker puts this place in his top five in the country. Awesome! The white pizza is the best I've ever had and my favorite. The new deep dish is killer too with a perfect crust! These guys remember your name and you feel like more than a customer. My girl gets the rice balls and says they are amazing as well.

They are new owners from back east, the menu has changed.  They have added alot of new items on the menu.  It is the real deal Authentic New York Style Pizza.  I have tried quite a few items and enjoyed all of them. They sell pizza by the slice, sicilian and grandma pizza by the slice.  They also have woodfired pizza, calzones, rice balls, pinwheels just to name a few. Tonight I ordered a pizza with grilled chicken, roasted peppers, plum tomatoes, roasted garlic, fresh mozzarella it was awesome.  You have to try this place, you will not be disappointed, trust me i know NY pizza, i was born and raised in NY.

Wow horrible. The mozzarella sticks were good, our food had no taste and the chicken was way over cooked.  me my wife and daughter didn't even finish our meals waiter took them away and we didn't get compensated for any part of it. 

They seamed more interested in making pizzas for people because those were going in and out all over the place but sitting down for a chicken marsala meal which tasted like it was made with water just stunk I'll never go back  

And the wait for dining in the restaurant, we just about left - we waited about 45 min for junk. And the size of their cups for sodas I'm not in kindergarten I want an adult size cup....

As a native New Yorker, actually from the Bronx, the search for a good slice became like searching for the holy grail. Bambinos is the best. Perfect crispness of the crust, the cheese and oil ratio great and the white pizza is to die for!!

I saw this restaurant on a list in the RJ. After reading it was known for East Coast food, I had to go. 
Very nice place. Very clean. It is a small place and fills up. 
We were greeted as soon as we entered. 
Service was excellent. 
We ordered two dinners. I ordered the chicken parmigiana. It is the first place that I have been to in Las Vegas, that matches what I always had in NY. 
My husband ordered the seafood pescatore. They were kind enough to make it with a garlic and oil sauce for him. It was a large platter of fresh seafood. 
The chef asked us how everything was and we could honestly say it was great. After speaking with him a few minutes we learned he is from Long Island, as I am as well. He told us it is all family working there. 
We will be return customers!!!

Bought a pizza to go for movie night. This place is walking distance from the apartment. Lots of parking and enough tables for people who want to sit in. Our pizza was ready and still really hot. When we got home there was more than enough pizza in the large to last two days. It's worth giving it a shot if you're looking for a nice local place!

We've come at least twice on a Tuesday and they're not open. Both google and yelp said they're open today. They have amazing food and everything but just disappointed they're not open when we've gone to lunch

Had a very disappointing experience tonight at this restaurant.! We ordered a Sicilian pizza and a salad and it took 40 minutes to receive the pizza. Other patrons who ordered after us received their orders before us. When one of the waitresses inquired as to why we were still waiting, I told her we were waiting on a pizza. There was some commotion in the kitchen and our pizza came out maybe 10 minutes later. No acknowledgment from the owner and no apology. Our bill was 42.00 without tip. We will be sure to tell our family about this and all of our acquaintances. We won't be back and no one seemed to care except for the lovely lady who lead us out the door. I guess they don't need or appreciate our business.  Our money will be better spent elsewhere.

ordered for dilivery.....medium meat lovers with mushrooms which they forgot to put on my pizza....didnt bother calling back because i was hungry and didnt feel like waiting for  them to correct my order......what is the policy for messing up orders anyway?
Ive walked by this place a million times, finally decided to get a pizza because not much was open at 1am. I ordered the gourmet pepperoni pizza. Delicious!

For weeks my husband has been telling me we should eat here. He's been before and raved about the place. Tonight, we finally went for dinner with our daughters and it was exactly as he said. Food was awesome. Fresh,  flavorful, authentic! The owner, Ralph, made us feel like we were having dinner in his own home. So welcoming and comfortable. Our server, Nick, was attentive and observant. The place was packed and we never felt rushed. My husband was right about this restaurant! We will be back!

Why is it so hard to find pizzerias that will sell by the slice?!

A small, simple place covered in Boston memorabilia and staffed by friendly folks churns out the largest foldable $2.14-a-slice cheese pizza I've seen in a while. 
And, bonus? It's delish. Top with a shake or ten of the oregano and red pepper at the table, tear in, and enjoy!

Or take it to go: they have the perfect small boxes to take your single simple slice home to eat in the comforting blue glow of your television.
This place has the best mussels and spaghetti sauce! I could dip the bread forever!!! Thank you so much!!!

A slice of heaven! This place is my jam when I want to grab piece of pie. The guys who own it are wicked cool and put their heart and soul into making the best pizza in town. All other pizza places are mediocre in comparison. Kudos dudes, NYC would be proud.

OMG Delicious......is an under-statement for this place.  Their food is an instant ADDICTION lol .....  We went there a few days ago..... then two days later we went back to buy sauce for our at home pasta...and this place is the only place we will go to now...it's really that DELICIOUS!  Go try it for yourself....you will be truly AMAZED...We're telling everyone we know about it.  I found out about it from someone who works at the Pink Box doughnuts so we thought we'd give it a try.  Enough said...D E L I C I O U S   Spotlessly  clean and the customer service is outstanding.  Yep, it is as good as it get's !  If your the owner reading this Hello from my daughter and I with the pup for rescue.  We'll be back again SOON  lol  Thank you for the delicious food you serve.  YUM YUM

I wanted to wait to write a review after the 2nd time I went because the first time was so good I thought I was over reacting. I just ate there for lunch though and I know I'm not. Since CGs has closed down this is absolutely the best pizza spot in town. If you are in a hurry they can heat up 2 slices for you fast! Stop by if you want the best pizza in town!!!

I decided to check this place out when that sudden craving for pizza hit. Based on the reviews I figured it was good. It was not good. It was flippin' amazing! Giant slices for a great price. I got two slices of pepperoni and two garlic knots for $6 and some change. The staff was amazingly warm and friendly. Really made you feel like this was "your" pizza place even when it's your first time in. I will definitely be returning and probably soon!

The best Italian restaurant in Vegas. Family style and kid friendly. The food and pizza delicious, a family owned very friendly. We come here often, excellent service. Tonight we're having pizza and salad so yummy.

The entire pizza experience is determined by what manner you choose to eat your pizza.  A lively topic of conversation ensued on our UYE about proper technique.  Turns out Loren F. and I are the fork and knife users.  Antonio preferred the folded pizza and eating it by hand technique.  Seems the rest of the table preferred the pick it up and eat it without folding it technique. 

There's nothing better to go with pizza than good company.  Michele H. was kind enough to prepare a large table for our group complete with appetizers and a little table for the kiddos to work on their coloring projects.

To the pizza itself, I ordered two slices of the vegetarian.  I posted those pictures for your review.  I believe I am correct in that this would be equivalent to four pieces of pizza anywhere else.  I was very happy with the taste of my pizza, the ratio of sauce to veggies was just right and the individual tastes of the vegetables really popped in my mouth.  I couldn't finish my two slices so I ended up sharing it with Loren F. and Skyler and LJ.  

As far as the atmosphere goes, it was like a cute side street pizzeria you might expect to find in "Bowston".  I appreciated the themed pictures, jerseys, Red Sox paraphanelia.  I don't get the large Citgo sign next to the drink machine, seems to detract from the rest of the memorabilia.  

I did look over at Marie T. dabbing the grease off the pepperoni and cheese.  That was a big negative to me.  From what I have been taught, the better meats and cheeses don't pool grease on the top of the pizza when cooked so that was a negative to me. That's the reason for my rating.

All in all, though I think everyone enjoyed their meal and the fried dough was very popular.  I decided to stay away from the garlic knots, fried dough but did indulge in a few fries.  The service was very attentive and I believe we were all happy about that.

I'd say this is a great place to bring kids or a small group for some thin crust pizza.
Service was good, pizza  was good similar tasting to pizza from NY. Meatballs and clams were good as Well  over all a pleasant experience. Food was  brought out in a timely manner.

If you like fried chicken wings coated in sauce, this is your place! Pizza is good too! I've ordered from here twice. The pizza is delicious, although just a little soggy in the middle. The flavors are fresh and authentic. The second time I ordered, the pizza was greasy, it was just okay. Both times that I have picked up my food to go, there are lots of people dining in. Maybe that's what I'll do next time! Service is good too!

We eat here once every 3 months since the new owners took over and generally it's decent food and service. This time, 2 out of the 4 items we ordered had a single hair on it. It sounds cliche, but it happened...

We were disappointed and discussed, so much that I signed up for a yelp account just to vent. I'm not sure if we'll return and give them another shot..there is a pizza shop on every corner!

*owner said they are implementing new protocol and offered to make things right with us..we are definitely not looking for a free meal, just a good pie! 

We shall visit again in the near future  and give them another shot.

I searched the Summerlin area for a great pizza spot and finally stumbled across Bambino's. Very glad I did as their pizza is top notch. Only reason I didn't go 5 stars is that pepperoni is just a tad too greasy. But the meatball pizza was just perfect! Ordered their baked ziti one night when it was just me and that was very tasty as well. Will miss Bambino's when I move from Vegas this month.
Amazing pizza! Well worth the drive from Centennial Hills. NY style pizza in Las Vegas. Crust is perfect.. atmosphere is very casual... good prices...
My new favorite pizza in Las Vegas!!!  So glad I found it as I've been searching for a great pizza for years now!!!  Will definitely be back and hope they expand to the Centennial Hills area ASAP!

Customer service : I was not greeted when I walked in and there were two people standing there. One made direct eye contact with me and said nothing. The other woman said hello after I stared at the menu for a bit and asked me what she could get for me. I said I was not sure so she just walked away. 

Food: I ordered the number two lunch special which is a slice of cheese pizza, a salad and a fountain drink for 6 dollars. The sauce on the pizza was too sweet for my liking and the dough was too soggy. The salad was good, it was just lettuce, cherry tomatoes and carrots with a balsamic vinaigrette.

It was my first visit today. I tried a 14 inch cheese pie because, if they can't do that right, there is no reason to go any further. Quite simply, it was the best pie I have experienced in over 20 years in Las Vegas. It had body, the crust had the perfect char, an equally perfect amount of cheese and the sauce was that perfect mix of gentle sweetness and tang. Everybody claims they make NY pizza, so it is no small task trying to find one that is actually credible to reach that lofty goal. Rest assured, this is it... no need to look elsewhere. I will be back regularly. Also the young lady at the counter was perfectly pleasant. A win/win for everyone.

Bambino's is right up the street from me, so after scoping the place out for several months during my morning runs, I purchased their LivingSocial deal and finally got take-out from here one night.  Overall I was very satisfied with the food -- it was very reasonably priced and most importantly, really good!! Here's what we got:

Garlic Knots ($3) - 6 jumbo buttery garlic knots almost the size of my fist (though I do have kind of small hands, hehe) with lots of marinara sauce - YUM!!!

Chicken Wings ($6) - 10 large breaded chicken wings tossed in your choice of sauce.  These were awesome and at only $6 for 10 wings, a nice deal!

16" Large Meatball Pizza ($13.50) - This is a BIG pizza for a pretty good price; great sauce, crust, cheese... definitely skimpy on the toppings though; I would've expected double the amount of meatballs :(

Despite the lack of pizza toppings, I'd totally go back here because the food was great and you definitely get a LOT of it for your money.  Service was good too and as someone from New England, it was nice to hear the Boston accent :) I look forward to going back!
I come here once a week. Food is great and the environment is great. Feels like your back in New York when you are in there. I recommend this place to all my friends and they come out loving it also.

The new owners are on to something good with this place.  The wings are tasty with the perfect amount of hotness to the sauce, (we had the medium).  Their regular pizza is great and is the correct size for a large pie, unlike a lot of places out here in Vegas where the large pie is an inch to an inch and a half smaller than it should be diameter-wise. Had a chance to try their "grandma" pizza, which was phenomenal.  It really brought me back to some of the great pizza I enjoy back in Long Island.  
The place is family owned and operated and I love supporting local places like this and I would highly recommend you, (the reader of this review), to do the same.
Best pizza in summerlin! The staff was extremely friendly and the food was excellent! We had the meat lover pizza and wings and the ingredients were fresh! We will definitely be back!

My husband and I were both disappointed in the pizza here. We ordered the Quatro Stagoni, and found it to be  somewhat soggy and not very flavorful. Also disappointing that the mushrooms they use seem to be canned. The garlic knots were ok though and their ranch dressing was very good.
This place was highly recommended to me for NY Pizza. My wife and I recently went there for lunch. The Pizza was OK but not like the thin crust Pizza in NY. The Pizza was too doughy.

Not super thrilled I must say... I ordered wings, pizza and a chicken Caesar salad. The food took quite a long time and by the time I got it I was super hungry and ready for something great. I'm afraid this place didn't really cut it. My gf liked her salad and the wings were decent, but I guess I was really disappointed with the pizza especially compared to some of the other local spots. I found it to have very little sauce and very little flavor. One thing it had a lot of was crust, in fact I can't remember a pizza where I ended up with such a huge crust that went completely to waste. Not up to the competition unfortunately...

The food was delicious staff was very friendly.. we got the meat lovers pizza but usually I always get pepperoni and mushroom pizza.. so it was whatever but my husband loved the pizza.. we got the bread balls (I don't know what they are called) with some sauce thing.. didn't like the sauce (I'm a picky eater I know) but the bread was good.. over all good price and delicious pizza!!

I'm not from NY or Italian, BUT I was told that this is authentic NY Italian food by New York Italian herself. She recommended that we come here and raved on and on about the food. So we came. We ate. We conquered.

This family-owned joint is cozy on the inside with friendly staff bustling about. Small tables are dressed with checkered tablecloths. Menu items consist of pizza, pasta, subs and other Italian favorites. I had the spaghetti alfredo ($11) and added two meatballs for an additional $3. My other half got a large all meat pizza with extra cheese. It didn't take long for the food to come out and everything was piping hot. The alfredo was good, but not the best I've had. I wished I had gotten something with marinara. The owner actually brought us a little bowl of it so we could taste it and DAMN it was good. I kicked myself even harder having not ordered it. But that just means I have to return. I appreciated the friendly staff who checked on us often and made us feel welcome. We plan on coming back here ASAP!

So glad we decided to try this restaurant after laser tag!  This was the best pizza I have had in 30 years! I also hail from LI,  The pizza was perfect. Oil dripping, lovely melted cheese and real great toppings. Service was great. We were a group of 9 with 4 boys! Can't wait to come back to visit my daughter so I can have more...unless they would perhaps like to open one in Phoenix!

By far one of the best pizza joints in town!! This little hidden gem, sells it by the slice or whole pie. Thin New York Style, Sicilian, white pizza, etc.  I had the Chicken Parmesan hero, perfect!! Not only is the food great but so is the service!! They also sell pastas which I'll be trying next visit!!

This is great East coast italian food! Best one is white pizza with white big sweet ricotta cheese on top & slice is huge! I also love their Tomato Marinera sauce spaghetti with giant tasty meatballs with sausage! everything there is cooked fresh & family business! great energy there too!

Good things first.  Delivery was very fast (20-25 minutes).  Sauce was great, good crust and the price was right.
I'm a chicago pizza person so i like a ton of cheese.  I ordered extra cheese and there was as much cheese as i'd expect without extra cheese.  The sausage was good but it was very sparse, they definitely don't load you down with toppings.

Well my (now) ex-boyfriend is from Boston, so we came to Bambino's a lot. I just love pizza in general but Bambino's is oh-so-good and their hot wings are awesome. The staff are all very friendly and fun and actually get to know you instead of treating you like just another customer. Someday, Tony will remember my name but in the meantime, I will continue to come here (while my ex is at work). hehehe just kidding!

Best White pizza in town & they made a Big Mike(that's me) special that was AMAZING! I have brought friends from NY here & they say it's just as good as home. The staff are Fantastic, friendly & always asking if we need anything!

I ordered for delivery and i knew it was going to take a while since they said they were pretty busy so I didn't mind. The only reason for the 4 stars was because the pizza wasn't warm when i got it. Other than that, the pizza was BOMB. I loved it and it reminded me of New York pizza for sure. I like that they delivery person brings a credit card machine so that's cool.

Just came back with a Supreme(?) pizza from here. I ate one slice and so did my friend. We threw the rest away. I can't believe all the 4 and 5 star reviews!! The onions were edible but the rest of the ingredients were so sub par I don't want to use the correct description. Sauce-lousy, pepperoni-tasteless,cheese-blah,sausage-forgetabout it. Just terribly bad all around. This is not like any other "back east" pizza I've ever had. I grew up in So.New England and know good New Haven and New York style pizza. There are too many good pizza places in Vegas now so I can't think of one good reason to ever go back. I'm going to go chew on my socks to get the taste out of my mouth.

Ladies and gentlemen, if you will please roll up your sleeves because it's about to get messy up in here. 

Been to NY three times and NJ once and this pizza tastes as close as I've found to east coast pizza

We've been looking for a place to replace our love of grazianos... Which closed but this place won't do it. It's in a delicious category of its own. 

The wings were great. Crispy and tender, not too much sauce. Good sized ranch came with it too. Not skimpy. Fries were limp, almost soggy which were still good but a little disappointing. Good sized but it should be for three bucks. Pizza was large and good, true east coast pizza here, the type that's thing crusted, extra cheesy, flimsy, fold in half, greasy goodness.

Love that they cook the pizza in brick ovens. They just taste different. Impressed she said it would be delivered in 45 to 60 mins and it actually came in 35. Awesome!

Love this place. Have a request? Just ask them. Authentic NY Italian. I've been here every week now since the first time a couple months ago.  Great value for lunch or dinner.  Family owned and operated.

The owner and employees are very kind and attentive! The food was absolutely delicious and the price is very reasonable! I love this place very much. I recommend trying the mussels with red suave, grandma pizza, and the Alfredo. Amazing! 5 stars.

A place after my own heart. From the parking lot, I could see the Boston sports memorabilia and I was already a fan. Then we talked to the guys who own it, who the people I was with were good friends with, and they were such great guys. The food was so good. We had the garlic knots, mozzarella sticks, and then pizzas. I was stuffed upon leaving, but I was a happy camper. They also had televisions playing college football, which made the experience even better.

The only this that could have made this experience top notch? If they served beer. I was dying for one with the delicious pizza. But besides that, I definitely give this place an A, and will try to go back next time I am in town.
Amazing pizza elaboration!  Had the chicken bacon ranch. Perfect crust, great cheese, kick ass flavor!  Loved it.

Great pizza and even greater people running it. New York style pizza in Las Vegas and this is the real deal. This is a great family owned business and Ralph and Anthony treat me so well every time I go there. Whatever I buy they always add more at no charge just so I can try it. Typical Italians.. Mangia! Mangia!. If you're from the East Coast this is definitely a place you have to try. Believe me, I know good pizza and this is good pizza.

Love this place! 
Fantastic pizza (cheese & meat~lovers), wings & garlic knots.  Family owned, great baseball decor, nice place to watch sports or quick delivery to my place.
Simple and bomb food. Nice little nook in the wall, great to chill and enjoy pizza.

The Grandmas pizza is amazing! We took extra pieces to go because it was just too good to leave behind! This place has great service and great food! The staff makes great recommendations and they seem to really care about their food. They come by to check how you like it and try and give you the best experience. The chicken Stromboli was delicious. The Sicilian pizza was also amazing. This is the place to go for an east coast pizza experience, something that's hard to find out west!
Great tasting pizza/food in general! Awesome staff!!! Loved my experience here. I will definitely be back.
Pizza is delicious!!!! Service was great and fast!!! Nice restaurant!!! I loved my entire experience!!!

My parents took my daughters and me here for dinner on Mother's Day. The food here is so very good!! The portions are very big. We had the mussels and chicken wings ( for the girls) as appetizers. The mussels were perfectly cooked, not tough or chewy. Plus the portion was very large for the price. If you ordered this dish on the strip, you would easily pay triple the amount at least. Ask for extra bread to mop up the amazing sauce that's on the mussels. The flavor is unbelievable. The chicken wings were very flavorful too. We also had chicken parmigiana, baked ziti, chicken francese, and a pizza. All very delicious and again ample portions. You will bring home leftovers. Try this place. You won't be disappointed. On a side note, my parents have been back several times since the Mothers's Day visit and my mother really likes one of the desserts, the Italian cheesecake. They went on a Sunday and they were out. My mother told the owner that they were coming back to eat there for their anniversary ( which was just a few days away) he told her he would have it for her. When they returned a few days later, he was true to his word and had the Italian cheesecake for her. Very nice family run restaurant.

My theory is when you order the pizza from this place they call new York, have them make a pizza there, box it up and ship it to Las Vegas with UPS At which point you have already left cause your order took too long  right? Wrong! At the point it's delivered to vegas you've already left so  there's a time machine at the back of the store. They travel back in time at the moment you placed your order and BAM! authentic east coast pizza... how else could it taste so good?

I am a new transplant to Vegas. Since my move here in November, in the Summerlin/Spring Valley area, I have NOT found a pizza place that was actually good. This sentiment is shared by my husband who is from New York. And I'm not much of a food snob, pizza generally makes me happy. But....i had yet to eat pizza that has enough crunch throughout the crust, good sauce, and lots of oily cheese. Many pizzas I have tried have a tinny taste or used frozen ingredients bc i could taste the freezer burn flavor. I just have not yet found "good" pizza in Vegas that is reasonably priced. That is, until I visited Bambino's on Saturday 3/11/17. I searched "Pizza Restaurants" here on Yelp and the reviews by New Yorkers, lured me in. It's a small hole in the wall pizza shop. They have a variety of pizzas. We had the Meat Lovers & Pizza Bianca. At first bite of the Meat Lovers pizza, i immediately noticed how good the sauce  was. Usually,  pizza sauce doesn't do anything for me. But the fact that I did get impressed by pizza sauce alone,  meant something. The dough was thin and crispy. There was so much cheese that it was separating from the crust and toppings were sliding off when i folded the slice in half. This pizza was EXACTLY what I have been searching for in Las Vegas. The crust had the perfect burn marks (not blackened,  but brown and toasty) which tasted amazing!!!!  The Bianca was delicious too, with pure garlic, mozzarella cheese and Ricotta balls. I am so happy that the Yelp community pointed me here. This is now our designated pizza shop. They don't offer delivery yet- they are working on it.

New owner. For me pizza now sucks. Wood fired oven gone. Crust now longer thin and crispy. They seem to be using cheaper ingredients as pepperoni 
Is greasy as hell and needs to be blotted. I'm done going here for pizza

ordered pizza bianca and bbq chicken for 1st time at bambinos,if anyone can say anything these pies melt in your mouth and have incredible flavors of garlic,olive oil basil,bbq with bacon and onion and knots so soft and fluffy abd full of garlic and john fantastic service from him a must try

We were big fans of this Pizza because the cheese had a great flavor until the last 3 times. The cheese is lousy no flavor!! So I guess now it's back to finding a place that doesn't use cheap cheese to cut corners. And by the way they are not cheap.

Friend brought me here for lunch special and to try their pizza. 

The price for 2 pieces and a drink is a really great deal and the pizza slices are huge.  Staff is friendly.

I got 2 cheese slices which are thin crust which i thought was cooked to the right texture. Only reason I'm not giving 5 stars is because my slices were a bit on the greasy side. I soaked up 1 1/2 napkins each slice. 

Other than that,  great place to grab a quick lunch for a great price ! Definitely fits a college student's budget :)

Perfect wings, perfect fingers, and some  bomb ass pizza! I love this place its my weekly Saturday night pizza joint! The service is great everone that works there is really friendy! Shout out to the girl that always makes our food, you definetly put love into it!I also get zeppoles every time and they are hella bomb! Great place great food and great service! What else do you need?

The best spot in town for a 2 slice special. For $6 I got 2 slice w/topping and a drink too. One thee best mom and pop pizza spots in town. Price is great and quality of food is amazing. Also the garlic knots are boss too. If you guys do try this place out. Don't forget to get a slice of the white pizza. You won't regret a thing at all!
I ordered because I was staying nearby. The pizza was awesome but the cannoli were even better! Definitely recommend this place.

I had heard that this place was new and had great NY pizza.  Since I live only a few blocks away, I called for delivery.  I ordered a margarita pizza and the employee recommended the "Grandma" which I accepted.  It arrived promptly and was very good but I was surprised that the pizza was square, not round and thin crust like a real NY pizza. No problem - it was delicious. Well, tonight I called them and asked if all of their pizzas were square. No, just the Grandma and 1 other. Ok. May I please order some food for delivery? No, it's too late.  It was exactly 9:12 pm on a Sat night. I said I didn't care how long it took and I was very close. No go. I said that Villa Pizza down the street delivers until 10:30 so he rudely told me to call Villa. With that kind of attitude, I will never order there again! Considering that I spend $100 a week on pizza delivery and tip 35 % or more to the drivers, it's their lost. Never again!

Great find. Had the generously sized garden salad that hit the spot and a half meat lovers and Margherita pizza that was fantastic. If you're looking for a thin crust, New York style pizza try this place. Service is incredibly helpful and friendly.

I saw "East Coast" pizza & was hungry!  Not only is the pizza perfect, but almost everyone (all generations) that walked in brought the same east coast vibes...  LOL.  As a NY'er, I approve this cool little joint with sweet customer service!
Great pizza and Italian food.....fast.

LOVE LOVE LOVEEEEEE!!! This place is fantastic! As close to a true NY pizza you will find in Vegas... or at least that we have found so far. Quite frankly, for us, there is no reason to keep looking once you take your first bite into one of their slices! We have only tried the pizza so far but boy does the rest of the menu look good too. I cannot wait to try out the stuffed shells! It is so hard to ever drive by here without stopping in! It is worth the 30-45minute (depending on traffic) drive for us!

This place is a cute homely place but when Jamie G and I planned this event he didn't tell me about it being a Boston place. How do you take a yankees girl and put her in a boston place? lol.....but I guess it would be a good place for watching a big boston game.......The place isn't that big but we put some tables together and it was good for us. 
The pizza is a good balance of thin crust, sauce and cheese.  It was a good pizza where folding was perfect.  They gave us cheese sticks, garlic knots and fries before the food came. The cheese sticks were a big hit with my daughter who usually won't eat much.  The zeppoli's were also a hit as she loved them and they are small enough you can have more than one.  The powdered sugar that covered them was an added bonus for her! lol....... the cannolis were really good with the perfect balance as well.  I got them to go and they were smart and put cream underneath so they wouldn't move in the container.  
The service was good as they were attentive throughout.  Overall the pizza was a hit and as observed by the hawaiian pizza next to me, the crust was able to handle toppings well without getting soggy.  If I was in the area I would stop by again for some to take home.
best pizza I have had in Las Vegas in 20 years....and they answer the phone with a authentic New York accent....terrific little place....
I love this pizzeria. Hands down has great customer service and there pizza is amazing along with many of their other dishes.

My Slices and pies still arrive piping hot and it's even better "Well Done" to get the full experience. They're slowly sneaking up on the Buffalo wing game also! As the wings have gotten a bit bigger also.

Holy cow, this place was great! Had dinner here:
- Complimentary bread and garlic sticks. Perfectly warm, crusty on the outside, soft on the inside. Yum.
Side salads with ranch and blue cheese dressings on the side. Are you kidding me?? These humoungous salads were SIDE salads! Wow, they were great, with green and black olives.
- 14" Supreme pizza. It's a combo, and really good. Nice chewy crust. Good toppings too.
- Cannoli - nice small size, delicious.

So, so good. Will be back!
Consistently great food, very friendly staff that makes you feel like family I would recommend this establishment to anyone who wants East Coast style pizza a good environment and friendly service.
The pizza, wings and ziti were very good.  This is where locals go. My kids loved the food.

Came here for a UYE put together by Michele H. I have to admit this was a little far for me, but I don't mind driving for the good food and even better company. I drove by this place numerous times when I lived on this side of town. Now I regret passing it because I missed out on some delish pizza. 

Upon waking in, it's a cute little place with about 10 tables. It's clean and the walls are decorated with numerous sports teams memorabilia. Michele and a few other yelpers already had a few tables put together for the event with some appetizers on the table for us to try. There were fries, mozzerella sticks and garlic knots. We arrived an hour later so they were already cold. I did try the garlic knots. Good buttery garlicky flavor. I imagine these would be fantastic if they were hot and fresh. 

I ordered the #1 lunch combo which came with 2 slices of cheese pizza and a drink for $5. It was 50 cents per additional topping so I added pepperoni and garlic. My friend had the #2 lunch combo which came with one slice of cheese pizza, a salad and a drink for $6. He opted for his pizza as Hawaiian which was $1 extra I believe. Our food was delish!! The salad was bright, colorful and fresh. Nice crunch to the lettuce and the Italian dressing was just perfect. The pizza was also delish!!! Thin crust NY style, which I'm not a huge fan of, but this was amazing. My 2 slices of garlic/pepperoni were huge! It was greasy so I had to tab some of it off with a napkin. No biggie. I loved how they chopped up the garlic and spread it throughout the 2 slices instead of huge chunks here and there. And there was plenty of pepperoni on there as well. I'm not a huge fan of Hawaiian but my date said it was yummy. Lisa G. ordered the vegetarian pizza which looked yummy as well. Colorful and packed with veggies. I would have tried it if I wasn't so full. 

Towards the end, the owners brought us fried dough covered in butter and powdered sugar. I pretty much ate the entire basket and had to move them away from me. Loren and I did have a mild choking incident when we both inhaled the powdered sugar on accident. Good times. The owners were very friendly and were very easygoing. They made sure everyone was fully stocked and had everything they needed. Great event with awesome food and awesome people. Thanks Michele H!

Visit on 12/18/16:

I'm not an Italian from New York, or Italian at all for that matter. However, the owners and employees are, and one of the diners that we talked to is yet another New York Italian, complete with the accent. He said that while there are many pizzerias around the city, this is the best and closest to New York-style pizza and serves food that tastes like it came from Little Italy. We also asked him about his dish, which was custom-made. So it seems they will customize dishes for the regulars.

That was his experience, or more like one of many. Ours started with an order of garlic knots and ended with a huge heaping plate of Bolognese spaghetti.

Garlic knots: fluffy, chewy, definitely not anorexic in size, and bursting with butter and garlic bits. Yes, if they claim to be garlic knots, shouldn't they have garlic? Yes, well, I've had the cheap kind at other places that have just some garlic powder baked into them. They come in a small and large order, but I recommend that you get a large order and take home whatever you can't finish. It's that good.

Bolognese spaghetti: house-made sauce with huge portions. My boyfriend and I had trouble finishing a large order. It is big enough for you to share with a friend or possibly two, depending on how much you eat. If you are a teenage boy, you can probably eat a whole order yourself and still have room for a large order of garlic knots and cannolli.

Prices are very good. They are about the same as casual Italian on the Strip, however, the portion size is HUGE and a lot bigger than what you'll get elsewhere. Very good deal. Service was prompt and friendly. Plus it was nice to hear the customers and employees talking to each other about the weather in New York and about cars. Nice ambience.

Yes, it's quite a ways off the Strip, but well worth it. Get over there already!

So I figured I'd try something different than the usual 2 slice and soda for $5, which is a great deal by the way. Ordered the grilled chicken panini sandwhich. The guy at the counter advised me that it would come in a sandwhich roll, but I was totally fine with that. It was like a garlic knot on top of the toasted crust, a caprese salad on the inside with grilled chicken and balsamic sauce....yeah that was friggin delicious. Pizza is awesome too, and a variety of styles to choose from.
By far, the best pizza place in town. Great food, great atmosphere, great service and great chefs. A very cozy place to come eat and they have more than just pizza.
Best NY Pizza in Vegas ! The Grandmas pizza is awesome and my honey can't stop raving about the white pizza !!!

I used to love this place. I was so excited I could get real ny pizza in Vegas. 

Fast forward tonight:
Order grandma pie with pepperoni, told to wait 25 minute to pick up. Arrived after 17 minute because I walked there and got there earlier. It was sitting in a box on their cool rack so I was confused but continued home. 

My friends and I all too a slice realizing it was extremely greasy.  I know with peporoni it's gonna be greasy but hot oil was getting all over our hands it was really gross. I bit into the pizza and it was just doughy. Not fully cooked. 

I called them to see what they can do to fix it. Since I had 5 friends over and we each took a slice they wouldn't just get me a new one next time or refund my order. I used to come here a lot. But unfortunate this was the last straw came, spent 20 dollars for semi raw dough with cheese and oil. 

Oh and when he was asking whoever what to do, you should press the hold/ mute button. I heard him. Also when you put me on hold, I again heard the entire order you took. But whatever, I guess.

This is easily the best pizza place in vegas. I have been to almost every pizza place. It is not even close. Get the wings bbq style, get the buff chicken wood fire pizza. The shrimp parm sandwich is really good too. Everything here is good, u wont regret it. Im just waiting for another location closer to my house

All the employees were really nice and the pizza and wings were yummy.

Edit: I forgot to add that the portion sizes are awesome! We got a small salad and a small pasta and they were a great size  !  I'll  definitely be back.
I used to love this place before the new changes   way too many onions in my salad and loved the fact that they used white American cheese now its just so so ...meh if its not broken don't fix it
This is my favorite place to get just a couple slices. Good size, good crust, good flavor

Wow!- that was a good pie our family just ate. The pizza was tasty and done just right. I grew up in New Jersey about an hour from NYC - yes I grew up eating pizza that was good. I've lived here almost 25 years now and this is just like back home. My first time eating here tonight - I'll definitely be back! Nice job guys!

This place is AWESOME. I should have taken pictures of the amazing food, but it didn't last long enough. My boyfriend and I get the Sicilian (+pepperoni) regularly and it's absolutely ridiculous. Like I die. I can't even. The mozzarella sticks are bomb too. And the Garlic knots are yum.
The pizza is good the meatball subs are good and the service is very friendly if you need more than that you probably won't find it. Good food and good service equals 5 stars.

I have always loved pizza and I prefer the love given to pizza by mom and pop type places than by chain pizza places. You could feel the love at Bambino's from the sport memorabilia to the checkered tablecloths. You can order slices or entire pizzas. There are a salads, fries, garlic knots,calzones as well as other dishes, but all I care about is PIZZA! 
My cheese/pepperoni was tasty= sauce, cheese, crust, etc. My wonderful Yelp friend, Lisa G graciously offered me some of her vegetarian pizza and I was in heaven!  For desert Marie T and I suggest  the buttered/powdered sugared balls of deliciousness that are hot and fresh out of the oven. 
The place is not very big, so if you have a large group, maybe taking your order to go is a better option.

My dad was raised in Brooklyn, NY and is super obsessed with pizza - esp finding a good pizza place in the desert. 

He finally found this little gem through a recommendation and took me here to give their pizza a try. We usually buy whole pizzas, however, we stopped here for lunch and decided to go with slices instead. 

Bambino's has an everyday lunch special: 2 slices + a pop for $5.00 - AWESOME!

We both chose their pepperoni pizza - SUPER YUMMY! The cheese was tasty, had just the right amount of grease on top, and plenty of meat on top. The crust was decent as well, ate the whole thing :)

The restaurant is very small and I'd imagine during the weekend evenings it gets pretty packed.

After Church this Sunday, we came with some friends for lunch.  We ordered the Chiken, Shrimp and Meatball sandwiches...simply perfection! Crunchy bread, delicious red sauce,  plenty of mozzarella melted over the meats... I have never had better.

Great little locals only place off the beaten path of the Vegas strip! As close to NY style pizza, mussels and antipasto salad! 
Thanks!
Good crust and that makes for a solid NY style slice. The 2 slices deal is awesome. Not a long wait and the restaurant is very clean inside. Will return!

As a native New Yorker who is a transplant to Las Vegas.
Just go. The pie  was delicious . I would have thought it was a good pie in Manhattan but in Las Vegas is a wonderful thing.
The family who runs it is lovely and make you feel right at home.
Like I said just go there. The next time I go I think I will try the eggplant  parm or the spaghetti with white clam sauce.

EXCELLENT!!!  Awesome pizza, garlic knots were out of this world, chicken wings were fantastic... Love it!! Atmosphere was perfect!! Service friendly. Highly recommended!! The sauce is perfect, you can taste the love from back home on this one.
Best pizza in town by far. The cheese and sauce  make the pie. I could almost eat this everyday. #1 pizza

Lunch again today. This time at Bambino's for the chicken wings and pizza. Great quick Italian in the south west part of town (Sahara Ave & Durango). I love little mom and pop pizza joints like this.  The chicken wings are deep fried crispy and so good to dip in ranch and hot sauce.  They open at 11 AM and have a great selection of lunch specials.

Monday, June 20th 2016 @ 7:30 PM.  This is definitely an East Coast pizzeria to the fullest.  I ordered a 18" (Large) pepperoni pizza.  I didn't hold out much hope since we've been let down a few times.

The gentlemen that picked up said it would take 25 minutes,  "no problem" I said.  This place had maybe 7 tables inside & two Televisions. There was 10 people total sitting in the dining area. A couple,  table of 4, two guys & another pick up order. 

Staff was busy serving pizzas left & right.  I watched as they served the tables & it smelled anazing.  Our order want ready for another 8 minutes which I'm cool with as long as it's good pizza. Total came to $18.12.

The ride home seemed like forever & when we got home all 3 of us said it was the best greasy pizza ever out here.  Being from Rhode Island we all miss the pizza, this hit the spot.

We'll be back since we know all demolished this order.  I normally post pictures but I didn't have a chance.

These guys are incredible. NEW OWNERS, so have another go at it if you have previously been more than two months ago. 

Sometimes, you just need to let the pizza do the talking. Let's try that!

Pizza - "My incredibly tasty crust and fresh toppings are crafted with love by my family that came from Long Island, NY. I'm priced well, and you can have me any way you like. Eat me, now". 

That does it for me. It looks, smells, feels, and tastes like an East Coast gem in the middle of the desert. Get here for their lunch specials and come back for the hospitality.
Brought the fam to Vegas. Used Yelp to find one of the best rated pizza joints in the area.  It was definitely good pizza and the staff was unbelievable! These guys are awesome.

So good! I came here with 5 of my coworkers. We all loved our food. The French fries were perfect and ranch is good. I had an antipasto salad that impressed me. It was big and had delicious toppings like fresh grilled red peppers, fresh chunks of mozzarella, meats, baby Swiss, two kinds of olives etc. I got the larger $9 one and couldn't finish it. Very satisfying. I'll definitely go back.

Some of the best pizza ive had in a while, this place has that savory wood fired taste thats just tooo good, combined with a good cheese and sauce its one of the best simple pepperonis pizzas ive had in a while
Had great time and a lot of laughs and totally enjoyed the place. Highly recommended the place and the people especially John thanks for a good time.

Heard about this place from  some co-workers I got the Supreme Pizza just to try it I added ricotta and  garlic pizza was super yummy also tried the Vodka pasta which was also delicious had the chicken wings too and I would say they were just alright I will definitely go back to try some more pasta and some different Pizza

Ohhhhhhhh yahhhh!!!!!! Finally some good east coast style pizza and its family owned.

There is some pride and love put into their pizzas. Great flavors and fresh ingredients.  Even as busy as they were they took the time to explain their pizza style.

I always appreciate good customer service so it's awesome to also get great food with that. Will be back next week to try some more off the menu. Highly recommend the white sauce pizza. Look forward to the wood fire style next.

I've worked at the cleaners in the same lot for over a year and a half and in that time I've gone to Bambinos numerous times. Their food is absolutely amazing, the service is perfect and friendly, and it's not too much to get authentic NY style pizza. 
Maximum time I've had to wait for a pizza was 45 minutes and that was due to it being Friday afternoon during the lunch rush. Most of the time I wait 25-30 minutes max and its always fresh, hot, and tastes amazing. 
I can't stop raving about this place to anyone looking for good NY style pizza.

Meatball sub is a must try. Meatballs are tender, sauce is great and bread is good and crusty. Top it with cheese of course.

White pizza was good. It was a little dry for my taste, but full of flavor. The ricotta was super creamy, garlic didn't overpower, and crust was perfect.

Originally from ny city. Been in Vegas for 18 years. This place is the closest thing to ny style pizza that I could find and have sampled a lot trying to find something remotely close. Wish I had stopped in sooner instead of driving by thinking another place with ny or easy coast on it trying to be. Well worth the drive and when your three teenagers say it's just as good from a visit to ny then it's got to be. A must try

Great local joint that was busting with energy. All the employees were very friendly!

My wife had the chicken franchaise which she said was very delicious.  It was a full 2 pieces of chicken.  

I had the grandma pizza add sausage and pepperoni.  The sauce was amazing and toppings were generous.  

Love local places like this where you can tell they take personal pride in what is served.  Will definitely return
Really enjoyed my slice of cheese and Sicilian. Will definitely be back. Looking forward to trying some of the dinners.

Eh, I should have listened to the reviews saying you need more cheese. We ordered a sicilian to go and while it was decent, it 100% needed more cheese. It wasn't as thick as the sicilian pizza I used to get back home, but it was good enough. I'd definiately go back, but I'd get extra cheese this time.
Prices and service were good, so no complaints there!

I love this place.  I wanted a calazone, they make strombolies.  She just stepped up to the plate, and said, I will make what you want! (cool)  So I told her  Just don't use the cheese that looks like cottage cheese.   So when I got it, it was so pretty, nice and golden brown.  IIt was love at first bite! Everything was just perfect!  I will take that ride to go and get it again!

So last night I stopped in, recommended to me from a friend and WOW Bambino's is excellent to start off about the Staff they are great extremely friendly and helpful. Now for the food we had the Grandma Pie half pepperoni half mushroom and it was perfect and I'm picky about pizza it was Delicious. We also ordered the Garlic Knotts that were also Delicious. The Large Antipasto was no joke it was large, fresh and awesome. We also ordered a Sausage, cheese, and pepper Stromboli which was very good also. Then don't know how we had room but the Canoli's and Cheesecake topped it off. Highly recommend trying it out. Thanks again to the Staff....

Not the same at all!!  Pizza is brown tasting=cheap ingredients and not cooked correctly+ Very oily. Stay away. 

Manhattan pizza is better then this stuff!!!!!

I love Bambino's. It is within walking distance from my place and they have a great $16 special-lg cheese pizza and wings. 

It's not world's greatest pizza ever but it definitely gets the job done.Check them out.

Talk about finding a great hole in the wall kind of place!  I stumbled upon this little gem while looking for a place to eat on a Sunday afternoon. It's a little joint that is clearly family owned and simple. 

When we walked in, they had this great welcoming attitude. The whole family was friendly and willing to explain the details on how to place an order which was very helpful. 

We got done ordering and the food was just incredible! The portions were HUGE for its cheap and affordable price. The ingredients were all fresh and made in house! The flavors blends nicely with each other and the plating was just very simple which is good. I love the fact that they kept the parmesan in the fridge to keep it fresh and they got all the spices on each of the table. After the meal was done they were very courteous and even offered if i wanted to try the garlic knots which were not bad as well. 

Another point that i found really great was that they kept their bathroom clean and smelling fresh! 

Will definitely go back and try the wood fired pizza next time! Let's support this small local business!
Always love the food here. Never disappoints! Now if they could just take the calories out we'd eat here more often.

Being a New Yorker for 21 years prior to moving to Vegas, good Pizza is hard to come by. Bambinos which is conveniently located near my place of employment really shined when I went to lunch and had a slice. The pizza crust was crispy and golden, the cheese was stringy and delicious and it produced just the right amount of oil when doing the original NY pizza fold. Of Corse its not exactly NY pizza because this is Las Vegas but its one of the best I have tried here and I am a constant returning customer. You may notice the 4 star rating rather than 5, this is not due to the quality of their food its actually referring to their customer service. How I am treated when I go somewhere is important and adds to the whole dining experience. I have been to Bambinos several times and every time I am there I am not greeted by any employee, the individuals standing behind the counter all look kind of miserable and unhappy and don't seem to really interact with their clientele. That being a little disappointing, it still does not steer me away from that heavenly slice of pizza. It is a must try, just don't be surprised if the employees don't really engage with you. Great food just not one of those old style family pizza places that makes you feel at home.

I have ordered here several times. Picked up two pies tonight, so oily and pizza looked horrible like it was sitting and reheated. Very disappointed this time. Not to sound like an ass but I'm from NY and know pizza this time it's not even close to NY pizza, maybe Jersey pizza (lol). Go down a few blocks to Villa Pizza on Durango more consistent.

Such a great hole in the wall place. Love the east coast atmosphere and delicious food!
As soon as chef sees me he throws mussels on the pan because he knows that I'm addicted to them! Simply amazing. And pizza is always made just the way it's supposed to be!
We have not had a bad meal here. 
Thank you for great food, friendly service and keep up good work!

This is one of my absolute favorite pizza places in town! The staff here are incredibly friendly and will try to build a rapport with all of their customers, which I personally appreciate!
Now the food is phenomenal! I love their buffalo chicken fingers and wings. Their sauce is spicy but not overly so; you can taste the flavor without burning your tastebuds off. They also have a buffalo chicken pizza which is beyond delicious!
They also offer several different pizza flavor options as well as different pasta dishes, where you can pick one out of three different pasta noddle options as well as putting a protein in as well.
All in all, an amazing place to get some awesome food!

If you like big honking pieces of NEW YORK style pizza,then this is the place for you!
My wife and I chose this place because it wasn't really that far from ourplace. What a great decision. The staff were all very friendly and if your a baseball fan there's all kinds of Boston- Yankee and Babe Ruth memorabilia scattered all throughout the inside . VERY EASY ON THE EYES.

The pizza was great , for 5 bucks we got 2 unbelievably huge slices and a 16 oz.fountain drink. I would recommend this place to anyone who's down to earth and enjoys a small laid back sports setting . If there is such a thing. :-) Overall fun place and comfortable - Check it out!

Part of my Pizza Bender 2011 Edition, I stopped by this place and decided to give their 2 Slice special a try.  2 Slices of Cheese Pizza & a fountain drink for $5.....pretty good deal.  I added Sausage & Pepperoni for an additional $1 ($.50 per topping).

The joint is decked out in Boston photos and memorabilia.....be prepared to get a talking to if you walk in here with other sports teams gear.  A guy with a Lakers hat was catching some guff from the owner.  It was all in good fun and they were both having fun talking a bit of trash about the other team.  Hilarious.

After a few minutes my Pizza came out.  It's a thin Crust variety, very similar to NY Style.  I'm not calling it NY Style because it's a Boston Pizza joint.  The slices are pretty big and you have to fold it if you want to eat it with your hands.....I like it better that way.  The Pizza was pretty good....above average.  I thought the Sausage was much better than the Pepperoni.  The Pepperoni wasn't anything special.  The Cheese was gooey and had good flavor.  I didn't have to add anything to the Pizza, I enjoyed it as is.

Overall, It's a pretty good Pizza.  If I could, I'd give it 3.75 Stars, but I'm rounding up here.

Return Factor - 60%....would be higher if I lived nearby.

Ordered a vegetarian pizza and chicken wings with blue cheese dressing. This was our first time here and we were blown away. Everything was delicious and the homemade blue cheese dressing was AMAZING!

Great good old fashioned pizza. Does not disappoint when you're in the mood for pizza made the classic way. Priced just right and sizes are just big enough. Usually we order the 18" pep with mushrooms and it feeds us just fine. Definitely recommend for your next pizza night.

Really good pizza and pasta. I usually go for the great lunch specials and my favorites are the NY slices (actual Long Island guys running the place) and the penne a la vodka. John is a really nice guy who makes sure you feel welcomed. I'll surely continue to return.

We are always looking for a good pizza, and this one ranked in our top 5. We have only been here one time, but when we are in the area we would eat here again. The inside was packed, and there was no seating so we just took our pizza home.

Decided to stop by Bambinos after driving by a million times and noticing they do pizza by the slice at lunch.

I was craving New York style cheese pizza and this place did NOT disappoint. 

The slices were absolutely delicious. 

$6.22 for two big slices of cheese pizza, drink and side of ranch (extra charge, that's why it was not $5, which I'm totally good with cause it's delicious and a large size compared to other places) 

Awesome deal and awesome food. 

Next time I'm trying the Grandma slice! Looked delicious!

Almost forgot to review the service, I was in and out in about 3-5 minutes. Everyone was friendly was attentive when i walked in. Great service and great good. I'll be back for sure. Maybe next time I'll share with my husband! Probably not...

Pizza was ok. To be honest was expecting a little more. Got the white pizza. They give huge slices. Maybe I just prefer my pizza freshly made rather than reheated. But if you buy by the slice it's pretty affordable. And the setting is pretty intimate since it's not a huge place.

This place never disappoints! They got their good chef back and things couldn't be better. Pizza is on point every time, the wings are killer. The food is great and the customer service is even better! Such a smaller family feel, we love it! Pic is the barbecue bacon pizza
totally respectable take-out pizza.  an upgrade on cheese quality would be nice.

This Little Pizza joint is very close to my working place. every time my wife need cheese and pepperoni pizza, i can even walk to this place and buy it in 10 mins wait. Owner is super friendly and the place is really clean. its remind me the NY theme under the bridge pizza. :) all around the food is fresh and tasty. That's what i am counting on.

AMAZING pizza they have here! Every time I come here it feels like I'm in an authentic pizzeria and the atmosphere feels like you're right at home, I always feel comfortable when I'm in here. Friendly customer service,happy families, and friends enjoying some good ol' pizza here. I love east coast accents so that is a plus for me. Thank goodness i live 5 minutes away from this little gem.

This is one of our local haunts. It never changes from being totally delicious! There are so many amazing options at this restaurant, so much supreme Italian food to choose from. The A La Vodka dish is one of the best vodka dishes I have ever had. Their calamari is always fresh. Worth a stop!

Small, nondescript mom and pop joint. Super friendly and inviting staff. Excellent, excellent pizza. Cheese is phenomenal. Dough was really good too. Sauce is flavorful, and a great ratio of sauce to cheese. One of the best pizza places my brother and I have ordered from here in Vegas.
Wow this place is awesome!! I went there tonight got 2 giant slices cheese with soda combo.  It's authentic New York pie.  This is a must go.  Nothing like a NY slice!!

Love this place. If you are looking for a great tasting spaghetti and meatball dinner or penne pasta and meatballs look no further! Trust me you will not be disappointed. You can't beat the price or the taste if you go anywhere else. My husband Eric and i are just hooked! We just love their meatballs. My husband orders the garlic knots all the time and they are so good! . We have dealt with a lot of pizza places here in Vegas and this one is definitely one of our favorites. They are so nice too. I have also ordered the meatball parmesan sub over a dozen times. It is so delicious! One of my favorites at Bambino's. After reading these reviews now I am dying to try their calzones! I hope this place never goes out of business. We just love it. The pasta dinners are only $7 bucks, where can you get that anywhere else????
