I'm so sick of these pizza places that charge you $13 bucks for spaghetti and meatballs.Really????  Thank You Bambinos for the great value for the dollar! You guys are awesome!!!!!!!
Very friendly family owned with great food and atmosphere.  Great place to go with family and friends.
Boring menu.  Need a different brand of pepperoni & sausage - they taste weird.  They use way too much cheese on pasta dishes.  Been there several times - not anymore.
Best veal parm I have had since Brooklyn. Pizza and staff are great to. Don't miss out on this little gem in the lakes!
Great food!! Being a New Yorker, I feel at home here! The staff is super friendly as well!!
Good pizza, thin crust, nice amount of sauce and cheese. The salad was fresh, crisp, and very large.  Excellent lunch deal: pizza, salad, and a drink for around $7.

Mmmmmmm! This pizza for me, has the perfect taste. I don't know if it's the sauce, crust or cheese, or just everything together,  but I can def taste the love. Huge slices!
Everyone is so nice! A def know all your neighbors type of place. 
I know people have their own taste in pizza, but this place has both thumbs up
Called ahead for pick up, ordered a veggie pizza, asked for well done, it was not. Ordered garlic knots, they were tasty, but did not seem fresh. Ordered a cannoli, it was delicious.

4 1/2 stars. I'd been craving white pizza since I arrived to Las  Vegas so seeing Bambino's caught my eye. Located on the west side of Vegas it's a short drive to the small but popular eatery.  I called my order in and advised them when I would be arriving.

Once arriving and not having any issue parking, we wewre seared at a table by the friendly male employees and started us with the half order of antipasto salad and put white pizza in the oven. The salad was large and had the whole kitchen of ingredients that made the salad outstanding . Timing was perfect of receiving the pizza which was rich tasting and delicious. 

I definitely was satisfied and got my white pizza fix at Bambino's!

More pizza please!!!!!

We went to Bambino's not knowing what to expect and with open minds.  We are pizza lovers and are always looking for the next awesome slice to experience.  What we found was a fun Boston Pizzeria.  This means lots of Red Sox stuff and super yummy thin crust pizza.  It's a great time to be had!

Let me just say, the Meat Lovers pizza from Bambino's blew our minds and we ate THE WHOLE THING in under 10 minutes.  10 minutes!!!!  I don't think we even stopped to take a breath between bites because it was so tasty!  We inhaled the awesome pizza because it was simply amazing.  It had flavorful pepperoni, ham, and some of the best sausage I have ever had, EVER!

We also tried some yummy garlic knots, cheese sticks, chicken fingers (yes, I steal my baby girl's chicken fingers when she isn't looking), and fries. Oh and the zeppoles!  I have never had a zeppole and didn't know what to expect.  They are Italian style donuts and are one of the best things I have ever eaten dessert-wise.  They were hot fried dough, covered in powdered sugar and other fun spices and were finger licking good!  Everything we tried was delicious, came in a huge serving, and at a very good price.  How can you go wrong?

It is a small joint, but it feels super homey.  The staff was always coming out to talk to us and make sure we were happy.  There was a lovely young lady, Stephanie, who was awesome!  I think she was about 13 and was on top of everyone in the restaurant.  She was running the counter and taking food orders, as well as being the welcoming committee.  She would even come out to play with my daughter from time to time, just to make sure she was enjoying lunch too!   It is a great mom & pop place and you feel so welcomed just walking in the door.  I wish Vegas had more places like this one!

Every bite I took in Bambino's was delightful and I will be back for more!

Hands down, BEST PIZZA IN VEGAS. Call your order in or expect to wait because it takes a while. It's absolutely worth the wait. The grandma's pizza and a la vodka pizzas are to die for. I love the eggplant rollatini, best I've had outside of New York. My husband is from New York and we both agree that Bambino's makes the best cannoli we have ever had.

ralph, john & bambinos!!

thank you for the amazing service as well as food!!
always a pleasure to come in and eat.

if anyone ever complainted about the pies,cannolis or service  i'd call them a  liar!!!!! you guys are aswome thank you for continuting to share your hospitality with us. you are appreciated!!!! =d

Went here with my kids to pick up a few pizzas and a Stromboli. All I can say is the service was excellent, the wait for normal, the pizzas and Stromboli reminded me of NY! 

They also showed appreciation for what I do and treated me and my kids like family. Very rare to find with some businesses. This pizzeria has our business for life. I also have to say majority of places I've gone and asked for a Stromboli gave me a calzone, this is literally by far the only place I know that makes them and makes them like home!

My cousin and I came to Bambinos after a strenuous hike out at Red Rock. We worked up a serious appetite and yelped the yummiest mom and pop pizza joint near us. Bambinos caught our eye so we set out for our highly anticipated pie. It was easy to find tucked into a shopping strip of sorts. We were greeted immediately and handed menus at the counter that you order at. We decided on a Cesar salad and a large grandmas pie. We sat down and the waitress brought markers out for my daughter. As a momma, I always appreciate kind gestures like these. 

Our small Cesar salad came out quickly and we were both happy with the size of it. (A small is large enough for two people to split) They brought out a  warm loaf of French bread shortly after. I indulged and grabbed a bottle of olive oil from the condiment/ utensil hutch and made a nice mixture of olive oil, Parmesan cheese, salt, pepper, and red pepper flakes. We dipped our warm French bread in the olive oil and it was heavenly. 
**What? We earned it on our hike, remember??? **

As we were finishing off our salad, the pie came out! Perfect timing! The crust was the perfect combination of crunchy yet doughey. With each bite there was crispy crunch, but you still have to pull a bit to tear the bread. (This is my favorite type of crust y'all) The cheese used for this pizza HAS to be some kind of specialty or imported cheese because it was so tasty. Lastly the sauce. A pizza is nothing with out sauce and I'll be the first to say their sauce was magnificent. 

Needless to say, We ate way to much. What we had left over we decided to bring to my husbands office so that  we could share the deliciousness we had just experienced. (It would have been horribly selfish to have kept it all for myself- although I deeply considered it.) 

Walking through his office felt like the cha cha train you'd do at a wedding. With every turn we had more of my husbands colleagues behind us following the incredible aroma of the pizza. By the time I got to my husbands office- most of his co workers were popping in asking where the pizza came from! Don't worry, I encouraged him to share. 

The ONLY thing I saw that I didn't LOVE, was the table next to us ordered a big beautiful pepperoni pizza. When it came out I was drooling over the smell. I personally don't eat meat so that should tell YOU something. The gentleman that ordered the pie called over my attention as he preformed an almost professional cheese pull. It was glorious. BUT than came the grease. SO MUCH GREASE. There was a puddle under the slice. That was concerning but I asked him how it tasted? He raved about how yummy his slice was while the rest of his table continued to moan with each bite. So I made the assumption that the grease didn't effect the integrity of the crust. 

Anyways- we can't wait to go back. Would love to see an arugula option for on top of the grandma pie!  It was absolutely delicious. We had a great time, wonderful service, quality ingredients, and speedy service. Great mom and pop joint!
Love the pizza, even the crust is amazing! Caprese salad was tasty and fresh. Buffalo wings are the best I've had. Definitely one of our favorite pizza places!
I don't care how far this place is from my house, it is the best pizza in the city. It's thin, it's crispy, and just perfect. Best grandma pie you can find in Vegas.
Sad. They are no longer. New Yorkers bought it and it will be NY pizza. Looking forward to trying their product.

Awesome staff, great pizza, great prices, very honest with times when backed up.

Great little dine in area too

Have a gluten free crust

Definitely recommend this place

When I am in town visiting family, I always have to come by and get a pizza. The pizza is thin crust and the sauce is delicious and the cheese is too. I am from Massachusetts and so are the owners, so they know how to make a pizza!

Great service staff and friendly environment. Pizza and pasta quality was average (I may have different expectations being from the east coast). Got the baked ziti which had good portion size, but could've had more time in the oven to crisp. Also had the white pizza which tasted good, but nothing stand out. Overall good experience, would recommend if you're craving Italian food out in Vegas.

Pretty decent and obviously ordering a whole pizza trumps the single slice option, which I wasn't as big a fan of. The cheese was tasty and the crust was very good, but maybe not as much sauce as I prefer. A solid option if you're in the neighborhood.
I travel to different citys on my job an i got to say the sauce is great! pizza is awsome! service with a smile! all a good combination! i recommend this real east coast pizzeria!

Hey if the pizza isn't greasy, it's not NY pizza!!! 
We discovered this GEM about a year ago and have referred so many people here that are from New York City, Queens, Brooklyn, Long Island even up state and the result is always the same, it's delicious. :)
We started with a regular slice of pizza, then got hooked on the Grandma for a while, and ventured into the dinners, the Stromboli's are delicious, my favorite is the chicken parmigiana one, we do however like the previous version of the garlic knots, they changed and eh- the other ones were bigger and a lot more flavor-able. 
We really enjoyed the baked ziti, the ravioli, spaghetti with garlic and oil, and my husband likes the hero sandwiches and the bread is delicious, so my review is hurry up and go! 
The 2 pizza and a drink special is great too.... Oh let's not forget the cannoli I feel like I am in New York all over again.
We absolutely adore all the staff, very personable, kind and their main focus is to see that you enjoy what you have ordered. 
Try it, you'll love it, and if you don't, try it again because something went wrong....

This place is awesome. Just as good as any place you'll find in NYC. And you can't go wrong with two slices and a drink for $5.50. If I lived in Vegas, I'd eat here weekly. I'd do anything for them to open another location in SLC, where I'm from. The crust has the perfect combination of crispy/chewy, which I love. If you haven't been here yet, it's time you go.

Love the chic parm
Everything great so far!

Went there another night that the owner he bought me a slice of pizza sat down with me at my table great customer service the waitress there is really sweet I'm loving this place I can't wait to go back

It's a small place, and we were a big group of ladies out for our once a month Ladies' Night Out.  We kinda took over the place and were a little loud, but that's because we were having such a good time and stuffing our faces on what turned out to be great food.  Since we all ordered what we wanted but ended up sharing, there was a big assortment of items to try.  

Three friend and I shared a white pizza, which was scrumptious, and a large salad that, thankfully, was romaine and not iceberg, which had a very good ranch dressing that we had on the side.  There were other dressings to choose from.

We also got to sample the garlic knots, veggie pizza, and the calzone.  Everything was terrific, but the calzone was extra wonderful!  

What I love most about Bambino's pizza is that the crust is not overly salty; so many other pizza joints drown their crusts in salt.  This one was perfect, and crispy, just the way I love it.  The white pizza had just the right amount of chopped garlic, creamy ricotta, and extra seasonings that bumped it up several notches in flavor.

Great service, too, from a family-owned establishment that I hope will be around for a long time.

* Customer service: 4/5
These guys are very nice, greeted us upon arrival, didn't charge us for last minute extra sauce and offered to serve the garlic knots before receiving our to-go pizza.

* Cleanliness: 5/5
The restaurant was VERY CLEAN. Both the kitchen and tables were spotless.

* Food and portion size: 4/5
We ordered a large half pepperoni and half Hawaiian with extra sauce. The pizza hardly had any sauce, cheese was average, but wasn't greasy and the crust was GREAT (cooked in a brick oven, fresh taste, not too thin and not too thick). But the pepperoni portion was VERY SALTY. I am assuming it was salty because of the pepperoni because the Hawaiian was PERFECT. 

As for the garlic knots, they were GREAT! Nice soft bread with just the right amount of garlic and butter. The marinara sauce used for dipping was excellent (very fresh and tasted original). 

Portion sizes were perfect for two-four people.

* Atmosphere, room capacity, and menu size: 4/5
Restaurant is conveniently located next to a 7/11 in the newer looking plaza. The interior is up-to-date and casual. It's a good size restaurant with a simple menu.

* Price: 5/5
Price was perfect for a large with four toppings ($16.00). 

* Recommend or return?
I would definitely recommend this place and return, I LOVE the fact that they use a brick oven! The only reason I gave an overall 4/5 is because how salty the pepperoni pizza was. But maybe it was just that time and day...

I ordered a large cheese pizza for pickup. The pizza was GREAT! Perfect crust, just the right amount of sauce and cheese, Great taste! This is how New York Neopolitan style pizza is made! 
The staff is friendly, the restaurant is clean. This is going to be my favorite place for pizza. 
I was a little apprehensive to try them because the previous owners made some really bad stuff. But once I opened the box and took a bite, I wasn't disappointed. Can't wait to try their other items!

When I walked in the woman was on her cell phone texting and it took about a minute before she noticed me. She was nice once she saw me but then the phone rang, another worker answered and it was a personal call. So while chit chatting on the phone she proceeds to slowly grab my pizza out of the oven. It was rather annoying but lets get to the food. Medium Supreme. I loved the dough. It had a sweetness to it but not a ton of cheese. Also had an order of medium wings. YUUUMMMYYY. Ill return maybe try a Stromboli next time.

Where do I begin?  This place was FANTASTIC!!  We just moved to this area from Centennial Hills and we are literally 1 block from Bambino's so decided that pizza sounded great.  I had no idea, though just how great this would be!!  So impressed with the nice servers that were very attentive and had patience with us since my 15-month-old was trying to destroy/eat everything they brought to our table!  We had the special for $19....a HUGE CHEESE PIZZA with 10 crispy and very flavorful wings.  Also had another special for our party and had pepperoni & jalapeños put on.  AMAAAAAZING!!!!  The mozzarella they use has the best flavor and texture.....and wow the sauce!!!!  Pizzas are wood-fired so the crust is a bubbly, crispy perfection that I always look for.  They have Italian seasonings right at the table to up the flavor even more so......we could not have enjoyed it any more and I will be back over and over again!!!!  Yum!!!  :)

Ever since moving to sin city I've been trying to find a local pizza place with great thin crust pizza and that home town feel. I really thought this would be the place to go after reading other reviews, but I was disappointed.

My boyfriend and I ordered a good old pepperoni pizza and some zucchini sticks for take out. The whole ordering process was pretty easy and the order was ready when we came to pick it up. Then comes the disappointing part. 

The pizza was soggy and super greasy. I couldn't even pick a piece up without the toppings falling off and the crust was the only crispy part about it. The zucchini sticks were probable the best part but the sauce was spilled upside down in the bag therefore making it quite messy to eat. You would think they would check the presentation of things before just sending it out to customers.

I guess my search for good local pizza continues.

Great place to grab a slice or I would highly recommend a sub sandwhich. 

They have great pricing for how good the food is. 

The owners have become friends of ours.  Since we use to frequent the place atleast twice a week when we lived near there.
Awesome lunch specials. the pizza is very yummy but the best thing is their calzone. size portions are huge.

Good deal.  Large pizza and 10 wings.  $18.00. The pizza is good.  They came and gave us two slices of Grandma Pizza as a sample. The crust was really delicious on those slices.  I will order that type of pie next time.  This place shows promise.  I know they are re-naming it soon.
When think you try it all and then you find better place. Love the place. Quick service. Great cheese. Recommend aaa
This place is hella good it's my second time this week, you get great value for the price and the people here give a genuine feel and is a nice old school NY place, highly recommended
I am happy to report that nothing has changed since the restaurant has changed owners. Still owned by a New Yorker who knows his stuff.. as well as the employees. No need to fear to return.

Wowwwww amazing place very nice family Business!!!!very good costumer services, the owner spoils us whenever we come by :) I've been to many pizza places in Vegas. This is hands down the most fresh, and tasty pizza I've ever had. When I walk in I see them spinning the dough in the air like professionals you could call them pizza artists. Worth the experience every time.

We had a family dinner here. It's a small restaurant located on the corner of durango and DI. We ordered a few items here but the one that was most delicous and tasty was the pizza. We ordered the supreme pizza, naked ziti eggplants, chicken fingers, and garlic break. The baked ziti eggplant was ok for us but we mainly came here for the pizza. So if you're around that side of town, it's a must try place! :)

Ordered a large cheese pie crisp to be picked up. When I arrived they were pretty busy for a Friday. I had to wait a short while and thought my pie was just being removed from the oven. Looking at it I was a little disappointed that it did not look like What I requested. Well, it wasn't my order and the next pie up was. It was prepared just the way I like it. Everyone was friendly and smiling while they were working. The close for me was the guy making the pizza wearing a white "t" shirt. Not only was it great watching a great pizza being tossed but thanks for the back east memory. Pie was delicious.
Very close to NY style pizza but not enough cheese. Fresh ingredients and great crust too.  For Vegas its very good for sure :).
Bambinos pizza is excellent.... We usually stick with the same sausage and pepperoni not real greasy staff is very pleasant and it's always nice when you're supporting folks from Long Island!

The pizza was tasty enough and the customer service was adequate. When we came in, the server was sitting at a table doing paperwork and stayed there until we were ready to order. Then she sat back down and did more paperwork until our food was ready. We were the only ones in there, so it was ok, it just didn't seem especially professional. The pizza was good, but it wasn't anything special. It was an ok experience, and I wouldn't turn down another slice of this pizza, but I wouldn't suggest it or go out of my way to get some more.
Best chx parm and calzone I've ever had and I hear everything else here is top notch as well
Excellent neighborhood pizzeria.  You can go in for slices, sandwiches, or pasta at lunch and get a really great deal.  The pizza is awesome - tasty crust, great sauce, and high quality cheese.

I normally don't do reviews unless I've tried a place out a few times. I have to say though, that our family truly enjoyed this small place with big tasting quality NY pizza. Service was friendly and professional. Our waitress, Jennifer was awesome. This guy making the pizza, obviously knows his stuff. Can't wait to go back. Our 3 and almost 2 year old grandchildren never ate so much. We had a Supreme and a cheese and sausage. Crust was great and the toppings fresh and with lots of flavor. As Arnold would say..... I'LL BE BACK!!!!!!!

Garlic knots.   Just ordered a delicious pizza after shopping and a bag of garlic knots.  The knots are ridiculously delicious.  Melt in your mouth.  And garlic garlicky.  A side of sauces and I'm all set.  The pizza is right out of New York.  Very few places in Vegas can compare to the quality of the crust.  Not to thick and not soggy thin or cracked thin.  Just the right texture.  Also the quality of the ingredients is high. The cheese is delicious.  I'd give them a ten I I could 

Oh...and the staff is really super friendly.

Finally decided to try this place few weeks ago and now I'm the duke lol... been going at least twice a week. Pizza by the slice can be difficult to find out here... especially at this quality. Love that it is around the corner from me and on my way home from work.

But wait... didn't even get to the best part... they have sicilian pies! And they sell it by the slice as well. My new favorite sicilian in Vegas... also convenient that I can see the slices from the window as I pull up to see if they have sicilian lol... yes.. i'm that lazy.

Anyway... give this place a shot and support local pizza places! So far everything I have had has been good and very fair priced. The staff is very friendly and the family that owns it recently moved to Vegas from Long Island. 

Looking forward to many more sicilian slices... now off to reheat one that's in my fridge :)
Great place! I have been coming here since the first week they opened.  Pizza is excellent and service is top notch. Owners are great people.  A small place with welcoming atmosphere.

Bambino has become our goto pizza restaurant because they have one of the best pizzas in town. The crust here is the best, light and crunchy. The service is very friendly, great place to eat or take away. I wouldn't mind driving to get pizzas or other Italian dishes from here even though there are so many other options around where we live. How can you beat their special of large pizza n 10 wings for less than $20.

This pizza needs a lot of improvement. The crust is a bit on the soggy side and the sauce is tasteless. In addition, turn your ovens up so the pepperoni gets cooked to a point of changing state (as in some pepperonis cupping/crusting). I really want this place to succeed as I do not like going to the chains but they need to step it up. Let's improve the sauce, put more of it on the pizza, cook the pizza at a higher temp and find a way so the crust is not soggy.

Best Pizza west of the Hudson!  It's authentic, tasty and brings me back to the delicious pizza I grew up with in NYC.  Even Matt's calzone's are the best.  This is the only place I will eat pizza and/or a calzone in Las Vegas.  It doesn't get more real than Bambino's.
As good as it gets for pizza in Vegas. Order your pie well done(a must!) and enjoy every single bite. All of the food here is excellent, so try a few things and you won't be disappointed.
I had the cheese pizza and zeppole, both were very good. The service was friendly, but not fantastic. Definitely worth the time to visit.

New York style pizzeria?  Oh my!  Cesar Q. and I were out and about getting errands done and decided to make a stop by this great pizza place.  

First off we have ordered take out from here one time before and loved the meatball calzone and chicken parm sub.  Today we actually came in and sat down for one of their lunch specials.  Normally we do all our takeout from 2 places close to home.  Villa Pizza being one of them.  This place has great food and great service!  While Villa tastes good their service leaves a lot to be desired (in my opinion).

We arrived just as they were opening and received a welcome hello from the guy behind the counter.  We ordered my personal favorite of Chicken Francese.  It's served with a beverage, garlic knots and a side of pasta all for $9.  Not to shabby considering how much food you get.  Everything tasted great and exactly as one would expect.  They offer fresh parmesan cheese, none of that stuff in packets.  There is a soda fountain so you can refill your glass as often as you like.  

The location is just off Durango and Sahara close to the 7-11 and next to the Subway.  This place has food that tastes as though grandma was in the kitchen cooking it herself!

So happy we found a new Italian spot that has friendly EFFICIENTLY staff and reasonably priced  delivery too!

I am updating to add that the calzones here are great.  We tried them for the first time a couple months ago, and now we have switched and regularly order calzones instead of pizza from here.  They are huge!  Also, it's not on the menu, but they will make a calzone with any topping you want, if you don't want the ones that are listed on the menu.

Authentic NY pizza. Good dough, sauce is not too sweet-- just right! The garlic knots are fabulous. Nice, clean bathroom. Really great service from Rosie. Overall, a nice place for a meal. I'd come back!
great place. food is A+. so is the staff and the service. first time there. ordered salad, pizza, calzon. all very good.

I'm originally from Boston. I have live in Vegas for 3 years... looking everywhere for a decent pizza. I've finally found it and it is 5 mins from where I live. I get it to go. I always order a large cheese pizza. Before I leave I put the red pepper flakes and the parm that they have on the table. It's a good pizza.

Best pizza in Las Vegas. NO QUESTION.
Living in Boston and being the daughter of Italian chef, I would eat pizza about twice a week before I moved to Las Vegas. I love pizza. I love everything about it. When I moved to Las Vegas about 10 months ago, one of my first missions was to find a local pizza place. Well let me tell you... this is NO JOKE or exaggeration.. i ate pizza every day for about 2-3 weeks, trying all different places in the Las Vegas Valley. (Even tried some in California) There is no debate: West Coat just does not make pizza like east coast. All you West Coasters will beg to differ, but that's because you have nothing to compare it to. 
Bambino's East Coast Pizzeria is by FAR the best pizza in Las Vegas. Those who claim the pizza is "too greasy" obviously have never eaten at an authentic pizza joint on the east coast. I actually found it funny when people comment about the grease.. that's actually how i knew i needed to try this place! 
The pizza was perfect.. sooooo cheesy it just ooozed and would come out in long strings whenever i bit into it! man i havent found anywhere in vegas like this yet!

Trust an opinion from me, an Italian chef's daughter who grew up in Boston for 27 years.. this is THE ONLY PLACE TO GO FOR PIZZA IF YOU ARE FROM THE EAST COAST

The staff is extremely friendly and welcoming. The pizza really didn't have much flavor especially the sauce. The garlic knots were delicious I ate 3 and went for the 4th and it had a black curly hair right on top, I'm blonde so it was not mine and it was intertwined with the dough. So, that killed my appetite. The knots are huge and for the most part very flavorful and delicious.

Followed yelpers advice and found this wonderful restaurant when staying at the JW Marriott.  Walked into the place and knew I was getting an order of garlic knots! They smell and ARE heavenly. We ordered a large meat lovers pizza and it was one of the best pizzas my family has eaten...the oven they use makes the crust amazing, their sauce was perfect. If your anywhere near west Las Vegas you must eat here

After all the good reviews I read here, me and my bf were looking forward to their pizza and garlic knots. I have used yelp going 3 years or more now but this is the first time I'm compelled to write a review. Garlic knots were okay for the price I can't really complain. But save your money for the pizza. Costco's or Sam's or even the oven ones from Walmart is better than was served to us. Very greasy, not very tasty. Even little caesars is better than this. The customer service was slow too.

We went there because the newspaper article said the owners were from Italy, the pizza was brick oven cooked and sauce was amazing.  Well, it was just an average pizza!  Grimaldi's is still number one in our book, and frankly Marco's pizza is better.  Disappointed.

Really nice tasty pizza. Had the margarita one. Delicious. My husband went crazy with the spaghetti with marinated pizza. Can't wait to go again.
Also really friendly staff. They care about food quality.

This place was surprisingly pretty good. From the outside it doesn't look like it's gonna be that great it's a little run down but don't let that fool you. They had a special, a large cheese pizza (you can add toppings) and 10 wings for $20. We got that and some garlic knots for $3. The prices are great and you get a lot of food. There was four of us and still took home 4 slices. The wings were bomb had just the right amount of crisp the garlic knots were really good too. The pizza was also really good not over cooked or anything and just the right amount of crust. The ranch was the good ranch so that was a plus. Would definitely recommend and will be returning.

Finally putting my official review!  These guys are family owned, so you know they will make you feel welcomed.  I don't eat other "pizza" places anymore.  My father is originally from Brooklyn as well as these guys are.  Whenever I come in they always welcome me and my brother.  I give out love to these guys and what they do on a daily basis making sure everything down to the "T".  I love my pizza and this is the one place I will go.  I will always refer people that I know as well as anyone who wants good wood fire pizza.  Don't just check out the pizza they have other beautifully tasting goodies as well.

First time here. We've tried a lot of pizza but East Coast was our first. The place is cozy, not a large dine in area, but it seems, their take out is a big part of the business. 

We saw calamari at the next table and it looked good so we started with that. Golden, crispy, seasoned well. The marinara sauce was sweet, rich and chunky.

Next a plate of spaghetti with marinara meat sauce. Again a rich, hearty meat sauce. 

Finally a 14 inch pizza, we selected meatballs, pepperoni, mushrooms and extra cheese. It was delicious. 

Good service, they're busy at dinner time! Good prices, parking is weird, especially with all the people coming to pick up. We will be back.

Just when I thought Bambino's couldn't get any better it did! There are new owners now from Long Island (where I happen to be from!) and they have knocked this place out of the park. Seriously, it is as good as any NY pizzeria. They know what they are doing - work hard and even carry out your pie for you. This family owned pizzeria is the best. Go in on any Friday night and you will know how good. You would think you were in NY with all the NY accents. Nyers don't go just anywhere. They are flocking here now! Give it a try!

This is the epitome of what a Neighbourhood pizza spot should be.  Priced neighborhood not flashy pizza is great tasting and straight to the taste buds. Real New Yorkers. As soon as you step to the register you see Mike making pizza doing everything the way it should be crafting the order like a artist painting a picture.  Staff is great and if you come more than once they know who you are and what you want.

This review is for the current Bambino's, they have managed this location for maybe 4 months now. The pizza is NOTHING like the original owners. Oily, average crust, uninspired pizza sauce, you get the picture.Will not order from them again. They ran one of the best pizzas name into the ground, to save a few bucks, i guess.
The best pizza with a good price. I wish I could eat this everyday. Gabby and the gentle men in the back awesome and nice. They give the best customer service. Highly recommended.

Pizza was decent. Customer service wasn't the best there's a small windo with some pizza out no labels  only small paper menu and the second you get to him he points at you I ask is that the pizza for the special he gives me a attitude and I say ok what's what he really doesn't explain I said just give me the lunch special pepperoni for $5 ended up $6.50. I'll return one more time to give them a chance.

We have been driving past this place for 5 years now and finally decided to get take out after a friend suggested it. Being from NJ we are super picky about our pizza and we were really impressed. It tasted really close to back home pizza. We will now eat at 2 places in Vegas for pizza; Roccos and Bambinos! The wings weren't spectacular but the calzone and canolis were excellent and the staff was so friendly. An employee even helped me to my car. Give this place a try! Reasonable prices too!

Came here for a UYE.  If you took the boston memorabilia down, this place would rock.  The pizza reminds me of my east coast youth and they rock with Faygo Rock and Rye and Red Pop.  They make beignets and let you put your own powdered sugar on yourself.  A small kid table in the corner.  The staff is friendly and the pizza is reasonably priced.  I wish it was a little larger and the seating more comfortable.
Growing up in NYC my whole life and this pizzeria tops every other pizzeria that claims they are NY pizza in Vegas. Very delicious reminds me of home.

Just found this place randomly.  Wicked awesome that they have Boston memorabilia all over ... what a hoot!  I felt like I was at home.  We have only ordered the meatball subs and the service and food were terrific.  Looking forward to taking the folks when they come out to visit.  Will try more of their menu soon.

Ok so for years I've watched this location change from one pizza shop to the next.... some owned by middle easterners ... some by nice family from the Midwest and now a New York settlement has planted their roots at this spot and I couldn't be any happier. 

Ok so my go to is their cheese pizza. The amount of cheese is out of bounds , the dough of the pizza is perfect it's just a great pie. 

I've had their supreme and wasn't thrilled it was over burden with sautéed veggies that weighed the pizza down and made it soggy so I basically couldn't eat it. I for and knifed it and I love love love veggies and I'd love for this place to make a pizza with just fresh toppings nothing cooked all ready because I like my veggies a bit al Dente. 

Regardless of that supreme pie flop it was will tasty. 

Well today I got my daughter and her friends a large cheese pie as this is their new fav pizza and I see this slice and it looks so inviting and hearty and I say hey what's that the nice lady with the shirt brunette hair replies "Lasagna pizza" I immediately go I want one now  I love lasagna so how could this be bad right??

Right ! It was amazing the velvety ricotta that blanked out the salty lasagna meats and sauce that was just folded perfectly over this dough I was in heaven I took one bite and said omg I have to text this to someone and showed friends and now here I am writing a review while finishing this pizza slice of life ! 

I think people love this place because of the amount of toppings but I suggest you make two pizza options light or heavy ! Have two price brackets and those who want heavy on the toppings can pay heavy prices and hose who like a nice balance can pay a bit less. 

Just my opinion. Anyhow this is Jen of my top 3 fav pizza spots in Las Vegas. 

The people are spectacular. I will say before there were some young ladies one with short blonde hair the other I've cast out of my memory and no matter how many hi's or pleasantries I sent to them they were never receptive , pleasant or responsive. Their customer service was horrid but now I see two older ladies as the other two probably early 18-22 well these two new ladies are heaven ! 

They are so sweet pleasant and kind. It makes all the difference it balances out the smart ass ways of the men in the kitchen and I'm sure those ladies can hold their own but what they give out to the world and their customers is genuine kindness and consideration and I appreciate it and thank them! Very tip worthy those two I'll have to find out their names ! 

Anyhow can't wait to see what I try next as I'm eager to venture into their pastas since this lasagna pizza has that traditional authentic lasagna flavor you want to taste. No spins ... no twists ... just traditional lasagna flavors on a pizza. A lovely meat sauce , cheeses and doses of ricotta on top.  So wondrous everyone should try it $4 a slice and I'm so full I can't breathe !


Oh and as to the Authenticity of this being a True New York Pizza I can't say because I am not a native of New York but I can say by my encounters with their clients I would say it is Def an authentic NYC style pizza ! 



Enjoy you won't be sorry

What can I say?! I LOVE THIS PLACE!! The pizza... killer!! The crust is PERFECT! It's chewy with just enough crisp. The sauce... I could (maybe I do, don't judge me) drink it straight!!! They use quality cheese, they take it out of that big brick oven and you can't even wait for it to cool down. I happily live with blisters on the roof of my mouth for this pie!! I pick it up to-go and shamelessly eat a slice before I even make it home! Their garlic knots are little bits of heaven when you dip, no no no, when you DUNK them into their house sauce, which I will admit, I do actually drink it straight from the cup. I have faith in humanity when I eat those things. Everything these guys make is spot on, and I just can't get enough!! Not to mention, every single one who works there, I want to be best friends with. Or at least they make me feel like I already am the moment I walk through the door. I love these guys! I will forever be faithful to Bambino's and YOU SHOULD BE TOO!! (Believe it or not I was always a girl who swore she "wasn't a pizza girl." PSHH has that changed! THANKS BAMBINO'S)

Tried this place the other day with my 5yo DD and we loved it! We got a medium pizza and fried zucchini and man oh man was it good. Plenty of left over as well as they were very generous. The gal that waited on us was very nice as well as the rest of the staff. My daughter thinking that she cooked the pizza looks at me and goes "Mommy that girl bakes a good pizza"..lol. I believe I read that they do a lunch time pizza special with two slices and a soda and that seemed to be a huge hit. It was a chill place and I thought it was cute the older couples coming in for the special and chatting with the staff. You could tell they were regulars and the staff interaction was just cute. Would definitely recommend it really did remind me of back East!
This is my favorite go-to for pizza! Seriously the best on the west side, can't speak for GV

All n all a good joint. Nice people. Clean and nice atmosphere. My wife likes the cheap mass produced commercial pizza places. I love these local joints. 
Good ingredients not to greasy thin crust the way it should be like back east. Just a touch of crispyness. I would give it five but my only complaint was the ingredients wanted to slide off. Now that is not a complaint because they were not cheap when it came to toppings. Probably had a touch to much sauce but the sauce was tasty n I am not a big pizza sauce guy. Good work guys and I'll be back. N if you haven't tried it support your local joints and try it. U won't be disappointed.
This is the best pizza in the western part of the country!!  NY style food,  excellent!  Love love love it.  This pizza is straight out of NY!!
I didn't even need to bite into the slice to know I would like it. The pizza smelled like a slice back east. One of, if not the best, slice I've had in Vegas.

Came here on a recommendation from a buddy after a Facebook debate on Vegas' best pizza.  Am I glad I did.  I'm a big fan of Metro and Rocco's for their NY style, but this is as authentic NY as you'll get.  

I wanna thank Metro's for their years of service to my stomach, but I found a new spot now.  Their tomato sauce is so good.  It's not too acidic but just enough to remind you that you're having tomatoes, not apples.  The mozzarella was rich so you got that famous string that stretches when you bite into it.  Don't think it's just "heat" that does that.  It's also the ingredients in it.  

On the way out, they even gave me a slice (on the house) of this round deep dish pizza.  I was thrown off.  I never ate a deep dish back in NY.  When I bit into it, it wasn't dense like these Chicago pizzas.  It had the fluffiness that a Sicilian slice has.  I friggin' loved it and can't wait to thank them when I return.  

If you're also yearning for that NY slice and have also been asleep on this gem, go now.

Absolutely astonished with this place! The food was incredible, and very well priced. Staff was very generous and helpful with my questions. The pizza is excellent no matter the type, or toppings you decide to throw onto it. The family at Bambinos came from New York, and you can really tell! I'm from New York myself, and even THERE it's hard to match what the owner produces. I've also read some other reviews on here which were completely false! When I mentioned prices being well, I meant it! Someone was claiming that pizza and wings was over 50$ which is outrageous and false! People also said that there are no specials, which is why I ask this one question: Have you even been to this restaurant? There's always specials available for pizza and chicken! I've rambled on enough here folks, now it's up to you to decide, and eat some of this fine food for yourselves. I know one thing, my family and I will be visiting this place weekly from here on! P.S. : Don't always listen to the negatives, especially when there's very little. Some people just get upset because they have nothing better to do but cause waves of negativity. Be open minded, and if you're in the area, YOU be the judge.
The best grandma pizza!  Co worker recommended bambino and I'm so happy we tried it!  Staff is great place is clean really can't say enough good things

Skimpy topping
Not well distributed, so half your slice has no topping 
Makes a lot of mistakes
Took an hour for the last 2 deliveries 
And the staff isn't very nice. 

I'm DONE with them!

We eat here all the time! Family owed and operated. Everything is delicious and they make ingredients in house. The cannolis are amazing!!!! If pizza is an option then this place should be the top of the list. The place is closed on Monday. The lunch deal is so good $5 for a slice and a drink! Can't beat it! A great quaint place for a relaxed date or family dinner.

I've been to Bambino's East Coast Pizzeria four times now and have enjoyed each visit. I like their very flavorful cheese slices and the special is a real deal. Last visit I added  Italian sausage and really liked that too. My wife enjoyed their Caesar salad with grilled chicken and some of my friends have tried the pasta and been pleased.
The service has usually been good and the atmosphere is typical strip mall storefront ambience but it is clean and nicely decorated. Worth a look for lunch or a casual dinner.

This was a solid A-OK experience. 

My man friend's poppa was in town and is a big fan of Sicilian style pizza. Heard great things via many of my Yelp friend's reviews about this place so I made the drive across town. Don't let my 3-stars fool you into thinking this wasn't a good experience. It was good, just not great. 

They were super busy at the counter when I walked in so I snagged a table in the back corner near the window. The young gentleman taking our order was new and a bit nervous. We ordered the Sicilian and added pepperoni as well as the Antipasto salad. The poor kid seemed really unsure when he walked away with our order. Our salad came and it was pretty tasty. Loaded with meats, cheeses, and olives - it was plenty for three of us to share as a starter. We opted for the Italian dressing and I was a fan. Next thing you know a large round pepperoni pizza shows up at our table. It looked delicious but it's not what we ordered.

Unfortunately, he thought we had ordered two pizzas. One large pepperoni and one Sicilian as is. I watched with sadness as the pepperoni pizza was taken back to the kitchen. Another gal came over to verify that we only wanted one pizza - Sicilian with pepperoni - and to apologize because the other employee was new. It was an honest mistake and it was all fine. The Sicilian pizza came out soon after and the crust was perfectly crispy and buttery. Super cheesy and the sauce was quite good. Not as sweet as other Sicilian style pizzas I've had, but a solid 4-stars.Unfortunately, the pepperoni was added last minute due to the ordering snafu so it wasn't crispy at all, but that's okay!

I will definitely be visiting this place again because the staff was super nice and the food was great. They did start closing 30 minutes early so I felt a bit rushed to get out once they started putting the chairs on the tables but the experience overall was very pleasant. I mean, it's pizza! And pizza is always a good time.

Freakin awesome! From the moment we got our mozzarella sticks the marinara dipping sauce was the sign that the pizza was going to be even better. Customer service is outstanding, the staff is very friendly. Well worth my 30 minute drive for sure.

I feel I have to start with a disclaimer. My sister is a waitress here but that didn't influence my opinion of the food. This was my first time eating at Bambino's and I know I'll be back as often as I can. I started with an order of chicken wings (plain) with ranch dressing on the side. They are among the best wings I've ever eaten. I'm not sure what they do to them but they're crunchy on the outside and juicy on the inside -- just the way a wing ought to be. The ranch dressing is made in-house and, again, is some of the best I've had. There's a major difference in taste between homemade and the dressings some places buy in bulk and serve on their salads and with their wings. I also ordered a medium sausage pizza. I know some people think it's a minus when the pizza comes out of the kitchen with that little pool of grease on top and they grab napkins and mop it up. Nope, that's the sign of a tasty pizza! The crust is crispy yet soft enough to fold for that NY method of eating pizza. The toppings are generous and, judging by the taste, seem to be top quality. I took more than half of the pizza home and can tell you that it even tastes good reheated in the oven. I can't wait to go back for more of those wings!
